locations.title: Gosforth Leisure Centre
locations.address: îƒˆRegent Farm Rd, Newcastle upon Tyne NE3 3HD, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
A bit of an update to my previous review since the gym has now been updated. In a nutshell, I've been coming here for over 40 years and I've never had a bad experience. But I have to be honest...

While the new gym equipment is great, the chest fly (an essential for any gym) is constantly out of order. And the Smith machine is the noisiest I've ever used - needs some serious TLC or replaced. Most other stuff is fine.

The mixed changing room situation doesn't work at all. To go to the loo I need to walk through the mixed changing rooms in my gym gear, past mothers and daughters getting changed. I eventually get to the toilets that are flooded with pool water and urine since these are the main (mixed) toilets for swimmers. It's not great. There should be separate dry toilets (other than the disabled w/c) for those not swimming. The current situation is insane and nobody is happy with it.

The staff are great and the gym has a nice relaxed vibe. I don't use the pool that often these days but it's generally been fine. On the cooler side but I wouldn't describe it as 'cold'. Sadly this building is showing its age though and by modern standards it's a 3* facility at best. The only proper solution is to start again with a new building and I doubt this will happen any time soon.
showerReviews.author: Andy Mac

Why does the Gym close so early on a Saturday? and the facilities have different times Sauna/Steam closes earlier. Not great if you work full time.
Wish I'd checked first. Other Leisure Centres seem to have better times. Edit: The Sauna and Steam Room area is excellent though.

showerReviews.reviewText: The pool is ok but the lifeguard has no idea about which lanes are fast medium and slow - which is advertised on ther website. Also - Â£6 swimming is ok but Â£8 on top to sit in a steam room for 10 mins? Come on.... There needs to be a swim and steam/ swim and Sauna option that is longer than 50 mins. There is no way i can do a swim and a steam room in 50 mins. I'd need 90 mins for that - am I expected to pay twice for that? Website very unclear - staff seem unclear on prices and rules. Pool is OK.

Overall a nice centre & I enjoy coming here when visiting Newcastle.

locations.title: The City Baths, Newcastle
locations.address: îƒˆNorthumberland Rd, Newcastle upon Tyne NE1 8SG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Booked online for a lane swim using the Fusion app - easy enough, although at Â£9 for an hour with the option to use the sauna, this is a fairly premium price. Nevertheless, it's worth it for the experience of swimming in this historic pool. Reception staff were friendly and helpful, showing us the way to the changing rooms. Changing rooms were modern, clean, and plenty of cubicles. Lockers are Â£1 (refundable). The pool was lush - good temperature, clean & attentive lifeguard. The session wasn't busy - I think about 6 others in the pool, so a nice, relaxing lane swim, with a super-wide slow lane. Bliss! Hot showers, but only a limited number of toilets. The price of the swim + city centre parking makes this an occasional treat, but definitely worth it!
showerReviews.author: Anya Chapman

showerReviews.reviewText:
Iâ€™ve been a member for nearly a year now, mainly because itâ€™s close to work. The gym itself is decent â€” plenty of free weights, enough benches, and a moderate number of machines. There are also plenty of pull-up bars, which I like. Itâ€™s not the most equipped gym (no Smith machines, for example), but itâ€™s good enough for my training. Staff are always around and seem friendly.

The sauna is honestly the main reason I stay â€” if it wasnâ€™t for that, I probably wouldnâ€™t be here. The gym floor is never crowded, which is a huge plus compared to most city-centre gyms. The sauna, though, can get busy at certain times, especially evenings and weekends.

A few things could be improved:
â€¢  The water fountains are poor â€” barely any pressure, takes ages to fill a bottle. Not a huge issue, but still annoying.

â€¢. The changing rooms can smell pretty bad at times â€” a mix of warm urine, faeces, and strong cleaning chemicals. Itâ€™s improved recently, but still unpleasant some days.

â€¢  Broken equipment takes too long to get fixed. One of the cable machines has been out of order for weeks now, and one time the cold plunge bucket was out of order for a month plus.

â€¢  The weekend hours are too short. The gym and sauna close early on Saturdays and Sundays, which is frustrating if you work weekends and want to use the sauna after your shift.

I pay Â£47/month for a corporate membership, which gives access to all Fusion gyms across the country. Honestly, Iâ€™m mainly paying for the location, the sauna, the pool, and the fact itâ€™s not crowded. If another gym nearby offered those same perks, Iâ€™d switch in a heartbeat.
showerReviews.author: syed ali

showerReviews.reviewText:
I was excited to come here, but was very disappointed. Whilst the staff upstairs were really helpful and lovely, once you got downstairs, there was absolutely no-one. There was a desk where there were supposed to be staff but none. I wasn't exactly sure how it all worked, so had to figure it all out, and then ask people who were in there.

From what I'd seen about Turkish baths, these did not resemble them at all. There were hot rooms, one steam room and some showers, which actually wasn't that warm at all. The "Turkish tea" was like a peppermint teabag had been waved over the top. Overall a complete waste of money for me on what I had hoped to be a very chilled experience.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Life guards are overally strict with the kids - for example not allowing them to have a drink in-between swimming and then raising her voice at the parents - the children were not in a area they were not supposed to be in.

Also kids got told off for being too loud - it's a swimming pool full of kids on a weekend? Bizarre to expect children to be quiet.

It's a shame because the pool itself is lovely but the lifeguards are awful to the kids.

If your a family with young kids I would not recommend this pool

showerReviews.reviewText:
An extremely disappointing first and last visit to East end pool, Byker. A visit to another Better leisure centre was so much 'better'.

1. Concession age 60 compared to 66 at Byker, Â£4.20 compared to Â£6!?

2. My booking was neither checked nor acknowledged upon arrival. No assistance provided in directing me where to go.

3. The changing facilities were spotless, Byker was nowhere near this standard, changing areas wet, strong smell of urine, toilets had not been cleaned.

4. Booked online fitness swim in one of six lanes, Byker did not have the six lanes, this ruined the experience! Other swimmers did not seem to understand 'clockwise'

5. The locker Â£1 was refundable, Byker 20 pence was not refunded.

I completed my 1K for CRUK as part of the 10K in November however the experience was not as pleasant as the other Better leisure centre.

Now to find an alternative venue to complete my 10K challenge!
showerReviews.author: Jean G

The timings for the small pool are very minimal, you are lucky if we can go in for an hour a day. I know they have to accommodate everyone but they have a separate small pool that children don't get priority for ðŸ˜•
showerReviews.author: Natasha Quinlan

showerReviews.reviewText: Up from Wales and took children there. Got there at 12:15 and they wanted to charge us full price (Â£14..... baby was free) and told us we only had until 13:00. Hung about and went in at 1pm. Staff inside were friendly but changing room's were filthy. Nappy bins were majorly overflowing with general rubbish stacked on top too. Entered pool.... Wife and daughter went to large pool on the big inflatable obstacle course and I took baby to baby pool. Baby pool was the most dirty pool I've taken my children to. Large insect on bottom of pool (as well as plasters and other stuff?) that I told them about but ended up getting insect out myself with their broken net pole. Definitely wouldn't go back to pool. Can't comment on the other facilties there. Getting back to price...... The pools we use at home which have wave machines and slides etc have family tickets between Â£6 to Â£10.
showerReviews.author: Christopher watkins

The pool is a good size,very clean and well maintained, but the building is in dire need of upgrading,especially the changing rooms. The door to my cubicle wouldn't lock properly as the lock was hanging off. The showers only had cold water, which was also disappointing.
There is hardly any parking here, so I'd advise you to park on the street before you turn into the centre.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Every week I go to the ladies only swimming sessions on Friday evening and the pool itself is fine but the water in the showers is absolutely freezing.

Each week I go, I hope the water won't be ice cold but it always is and last time I went the hair dryer was broken as well.

People go swimming to improve their health but then are bound to get ill if they have to use freezing cold water to clean themselves with before going outside in the cold weather.

I don't know if this is a ploy to save water by making people decide to shower at home so they don't get doused in the ice cold water of the showers but it is really discouraging, especially for the ladies from the local community who want to improve their health and can only come at certain times when the ladies only sessions are.
showerReviews.author: Farzana Nahar

showerReviews.reviewText:
5 friends went for a swim and the staff turned them away at the door because they were in a group of more than 4 (a rule that they were unaware of).

The staff were incredibly hostile and treated the group as if they were being unreasonable when in fact they just wanted to swim.

When they returned later on in a smaller group, the staff continued to treat them as if they were breaking the rules, when in fact they were following all the rules.

I understand rules are rules, but the staff immediately assumed the group were aware of the rules and were purposefully breaking them, which is completely unfair.

The first swimming pool iâ€™ve been to that gets angry at customers for wanting to pay money to swim.

I wonâ€™t be going back here.
showerReviews.author: Seth Crowther

showerReviews.reviewText:
Iâ€™ve been a regular visitor to Jesmond Pool for about three years, typically going once or twice a week, and it has easily become one of the best pools in the local area. What originally drew me to Jesmond Pool was its fantastic opening hours. Unlike most local authority pools that close around 4 or 5 p.m., Jesmond Pool stays open until as late as 10 p.m. on some nights. For anyone working a 9â€“5 job, this is a blessing, as itâ€™s one of the only pools in the area offering such convenient evening hours.

Facilities

Despite the age of the building (over 100 years old), the pool is exceptionally well-maintained. It may be relatively small, but that doesnâ€™t take away from its cleanliness and the atmosphere it provides. I also use the gym facilities, which are surprisingly well-equipped for their size. The gym, located in the basement, includes multiple squat racks and equipment for all major muscle groups. The only limitation is the space itself, but the team does an incredible job of packing in everything youâ€™d need for a full workout. Unless youâ€™re a hardcore bodybuilder looking for old-school, niche equipment, youâ€™ll find everything you need!

Staff & Customer Service

The staff at Jesmond Pool are second to none. Theyâ€™re not only professional but genuinely friendly and knowledgeable, especially when it comes to the swimming lessons offered. A special shoutout goes to Alex, Donna, and their team, who ensure lessons are both fun and highly professional. Matty always greets visitors with a smile, and Phil and the management team are some of the kindest, most community-driven people Iâ€™ve ever met. Their passion for swimming and love for the local community shines through, making Jesmond Pool stand out from the more commercial gyms and pools. The community spirit here is truly unrivaled in the North East.

Community Feel & Ambience

Jesmond Pool has a unique, welcoming, and community-driven atmosphere thatâ€™s hard to find anywhere else. Itâ€™s clear that the staff and trustees run this facility out of love for the community, which is reflected in every aspect of the service.
Accessibility & Cleanliness

Located close to West Jesmond Metro, Jesmond Pool is extremely accessible by public transport, though parking can be a bit tricky given itâ€™s in a residential area. But honestly, the small, close-knit nature of the pool is what makes it so special. If it had a giant multi-storey car park, it would lose the intimate charm that makes it a hidden gem in the North East.

The changing rooms, showers, and general cleanliness of the facility are top-notch. Considering the buildingâ€™s age and the limited space, the team does an excellent job of keeping everything clean and in working order.

Value for Money

Jesmond Pool is managed by a local charitable trust, and they do a remarkable job of keeping the facility open and affordable. For instance, a swim, steam, and sauna session costs just Â£7, and lockers are a mere 20pâ€”a small price to pay to support the upkeep of such a fantastic community facility.

Favorite Aspect

What I love most about Jesmond Pool is the community spirit and the friendliness of the staff. Itâ€™s a place where you feel welcomed and valued, and thatâ€™s something money canâ€™t buy.
Would I Recommend It?

Jesmond Pool is a true treasure in the Newcastle area, and I couldnâ€™t recommend it more highly. Big up the Jesmond Pool massive!
showerReviews.author: James Green

showerReviews.reviewText:
In response to the reply I received:

Thank you for your response. I appreciate you taking the time to address my concerns. However, I would like to clarify a few points:

1. Shoe Policy: I understand the need to keep the changing rooms clean, but my concern is more about the hygiene of having to walk through wet areas with bare feet, especially when cleanliness is already an issue. As well as the inconvenience caused by having to remove shoes and sockâ€™s constantly. Perhaps providing shoe covers or some form of path would be more hygienic for everyone. Having reception staff say â€œwe have cut down on cleaningâ€ isnâ€™t what you want to hear.

2. Equipment Condition: While the equipment may be new, Iâ€™ve noticed that some machines are stiff and difficult to use, or make noises which indicate that there may be a maintenance issue or just something that needs adjustment.

3. Operating Hours: My comment about early closures was based on my experience, which may have been during holiday hours or exceptions. It would be helpful if holiday hours were communicated more clearly to avoid any confusion. For example, I arrived on a Sunday at 16:25 and the doors were locked - there were two other people having the exact same issue so evidently there is confusion. This happened on 2 or 3 occasions not just once.

4. Temperature and Air Conditioning: The air conditioning might be new, but during my visits, it hasnâ€™t felt sufficient to keep the gym at a comfortable temperature. If possible, please look into ensuring that the temperature is more consistently regulated.

Finally, I found the tone of your response to be quite dismissive and unprofessional, particularly with the repeated use of the word "hardly." While I understand the need to defend your facility, itâ€™s important to acknowledge customer concerns without undermining them. A more constructive and respectful response would go a long way in maintaining a positive relationship with your members who are evidently frustrated when paying for a service that isnâ€™t up to standard. If your customers are telling you the gym and pool is unhygienic (as many of the reviews state) maybe stop telling your customers they are wrong, take the feedback and use it productively.
Thanks!

Probably the worst gym Iâ€™ve ever been to.
So unhygienic itâ€™s beyond a joke, changing rooms absolutely stink of urine. Also now have to take your shoes off to get to one part of the gym which then leaves your feet soaking wet as you have to walk through the changing rooms/ pool because theyâ€™ve â€œcut back on cleaningâ€ to Quote one of the guys on reception. Donâ€™t really know how itâ€™s possible to cut back anymore than it already was. Also not what you want to hear from your gym when gyms are notorious for bacteria and germs anyway. Had to go and get my own shoe covers because I think itâ€™s disgusting having to take my shoes and socks off twice to get in and out of the gym and walk through the grim changing rooms. Equipment is poorly maintained and stiff. Not worth the price at all. Also close early all the time so youâ€™ll arrive to do a session and itâ€™s already closed. Both sections of gym boiling hot also with barely any, if any at all air conditioning .
showerReviews.author: Clo

showerReviews.reviewText:
Excellent, well maintained charity-run community gym and pool.

All of the equipment is less than 18 months old and the space in both gyms is maximised as much as possible. Constant updates to all areas of the building to make it as modern as possible given its listed status.

For example, the changing rooms in the process of being completely remodelled and updated, the building is being reroofed in preparation for solar panelling to be installed, and the heating systems for the pool are also getting completely replaced to be 100% renewable by the end of 2026.

Can get hot and humid given the proximity to the pool itself and it is annoying having to take your shoes off to access the upstairs gym, but all pools have strict no shoes policies in place in changing/poolside areas.

Theyâ€™re currently looking at adding significantly to the class schedule along with other additions making it easily the best value for money gym & pool in the area.

They always aim to do the absolute best they can given the tight restrictions in place because of the building itself and the volunteer element of any charity and most certainly hit the mark. Would absolutely recommend this place without a secondâ€™s hesitation.
showerReviews.author: Samuel Philbrick

locations.title: Marriott Leisure Club
locations.address: îƒˆNewcastle Marriott Hotel, MetroCentre, Gateshead NE11 9XF, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The leisure club has really gone downhill over the past few years. I used to regularly attend this gym about five years ago, but I rejoined a couple of months back, and while there is new equipment in the gym, the pool, sauna, and changing facilities have dropped well below par.

The changing rooms are often dirty, partly due to the mess left by visitors, but mostly because of grime and dirt that simply isn't cleaned up. They really need a deep clean, regular cleaning, and a bit of a refresh.

The lockers are often blocked off, likely because people put in combinations and then leave them locked. I'm not sure how often these are checked, but I doubt they're locked by different people daily.

The showers have mould around the edges.

The steam room is the area of biggest concern. There is visible black mould on the grouting throughout the steam room, and tiles are missing from the seat. This is particularly worrying as you're breathing in steam mixed with whatever is growing there. If that's whatâ€™s visible to people, what's going on behind the scenes?

The pool is often checked by staff in the evening, but the cleanliness overall still raises questions.

The day staff seem friendly, but the night staff often appear to be working alone and must have a lot of tasks that one person simply canâ€™t manage. Cleaning should not be their responsibility.
showerReviews.author: Connor Anderson

showerReviews.reviewText:
I had a very disappointing experience at this swimming pool. At the entrance, the cashier was unfriendly and unhelpful. The locker system was very inconvenient â€“ you can only lock and unlock it once, which makes it difficult if you need to go back later. The changing rooms were very small, the toilets had a bad smell with no proper ventilation, and the shower cabins were tiny, with no place to hang clothes or a towel.

In the pool area, we were told at the cashier that half of the pool would be closed, but when we got inside, the only proper swimming lane was also shut down soon after because of childrenâ€™s swimming lessons. The lifeguard asked us to move to the family area, which was extremely crowded and too shallow to swim properly. When several swimmers complained, the lifeguard showed no understanding and just told us to â€œtry anyway,â€ which was not acceptable.

We stayed only about 15 minutes before leaving, because it was impossible to swim. On top of this, when I found and returned a lost phone to the cashier, there was not even a simple â€œthank you.â€ The staff were generally unfriendly, and the whole experience was unpleasant.

I would not return here again, and I would not recommend it to others.
showerReviews.author: GÃ¡l IstvÃ¡n

showerReviews.reviewText: Absolutely horrendous company ripping off parents! This company 'Better leisure'  took over from our local council where my daughter has recently finished swimming lessons as she's completed all the levels. 3 days before they took over, we were told by reception at the club that we shouldnt cancel the newly set up direct debit as it would mean we would get charged a fee, and to wait until the day they took over then call in and let them know that our daughter was already signed off the full course of lessons so it was just to be closed down. They however have ported over my 'membership', which i have never had, we weren't members of the leisure club, we just paid for our daughters swimming lessons, and have charged us for a full months swimming lessons, that she is not in as she has completed them all, and are not refunding the money! Complete and utter scam! You have to submit a refund request online, cannot talk to anyone, and then they just ignore the issue and do whatever they want! I've paid Â£34 for literally nothing, not one single lesson!! They have 'credited' Â£8 to my 'account', so are keeping the rest by the looks of it. And for what??? Not a single lesson!!!! We didn't sign up for any membership ever. When the lessons are finished that's it. I will be disputing this with the bank to claim the money back. Disgusting company and disgusting lack of any customer service. Making money by blatently stealing money from parents!!!
showerReviews.author: alex Bell

showerReviews.reviewText:
Going swimming for the past 10 years. Staff at the reception is always friendly to me, especially Jill, who helps when I struggle with anything eg the new â€œbetter UKâ€ app.
However, last Friday I felt, I was in the wrong film. After the aerobic class finished, a group of elderly women (like every Friday) gathered in the middle of the pool and started chatting. Like every week, my friend and I try to swim around them together with other swimmers. This made me swimming close to the fast lane. A young man from that lane soaked me, especially my hair, which I wanted to keep dry for an appointment afterwards. I never said anything in the past but this time I felt I had to say something as I wasnâ€™t the only person, who got splashed by his swimming style. I asked him politely if he could be a bit more considerate but he cheekily replied if I was serious and that I shouldnâ€™t swim so close to his lane. I explained that the pool was full and the only thing I wanted was a bit of consideration when so many people are around. He then said this is a pool and that Iâ€™m silly. Next he turned around to the lifeguard, a young woman with glasses, who agreed with him. I bit my tongue but I wished I told her if she would have done her job and told the elderly group of women just once to move on to the side of the pool,  this incident could have been avoided. I was also disappointed in her response towards me as this proved only a lackadaisical attitude towards lifeguardâ€™s duties.
showerReviews.author: Tina Turner

locations.title: The Gym Group Newcastle City
locations.address: îƒˆFloor, South, Tower Entrance, Newgate Street Basement, Newcastle upon Tyne NE1 5RF, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Having just read the reviews posted in the last 2 weeks which focus on hygiene / mens changing rooms with remarkably similar comments (hit job?) I feel compelled to give my opinions. I've used this venue for over 5 years now, successfully completing over 800 substantial workouts all at the busiest times of day (up to full body workouts usually of 2.5 hours plus) and always change before / shower afterwards in the aforementioned changing rooms.

I would disagree with almost every comment made (c.95%+) in these reviews and invite those responsible for making them to join me for a workout where we can discuss politely as fellow users the demands of keeping this venue up to the very high standards set whilst accommodating a weekly throughput of users that likely runs into several thousands.

This is somewhere that a very broad diverse group of people go to sweat, elevate their heart rates, raise their respiratory levels and thus improve their health and well-being. This can be a very unhygienic process, especially for men. It's also amazing value for money, and all the staff team (including the management) work tirelessly to keep the entire facility and equipment (thousands of items from single disc weights to complex electro-mechanical machinery and hundreds of lockers) in usable order. If your expectations are of standards equivalent to the Talise Spa at The Burj Al Arab it isn't going to happen !!!

There are also a very small number who go expecting to massively boost their physical attributes with minimal effort then look for any possible excuses for their meagre (if any) gainz. Not that I'm saying this is the case here........

I had successful surgery 2.5 years ago following a traffic collision to remove a cancerous lesion from my skull following a blunt trauma brain injury. Once able to train again I much preferred using the fantastic fully controllable shower facilities at this gym to support my ongoing recovery (and still do) as I have every faith in their entire cleaning regime. Yes the mens changing rooms very occasionally smell but nowhere near as bad as stated and mostly because some men very occasionally smell (and can be unhygienic). This is gym life / manhood innit.

Perhaps some people should stop playing the whinging complaining moaning victim card and start knuckling down to some serious gym based exercise whilst accepting the short term sweatiness that accompanies it. Not that I'm saying this is the case here........
showerReviews.author: tony herron

showerReviews.reviewText:
This gym is an absolute nightmare when it comes to hygiene and cleanliness. The menâ€™s toilets and changing rooms are revolting, often filled with an unbearable stench that makes you question the cleaning schedule, if there even is one.

Itâ€™s shocking how many people use the facilities and then walk right out without washing their hands, spreading who knows what across every surface. The weights area, especially during busy times, becomes a hotspot for sweat, grime, and complete disregard for shared equipment. Thereâ€™s a general sense that hygiene is an afterthought for many of the members, and it shows in the condition of the place. I even came across a review describing someone leaving faeces on gym equipment, which honestly doesnâ€™t feel too far-fetched after what Iâ€™ve seen. If youâ€™re even slightly concerned about catching something or being in a space that respects cleanliness and community, avoid this gym entirely

showerReviews.reviewText:
The gym is a decent size, classes and instructors are great (although watch out as some classes you still have to pay, depending on your membership and everyone has to pay for reformer Pilates regardless of your tier). The club also has modern equipment however, the price just doesnâ€™t match whatâ€™s on offer. The air-con seldom works, lots of equipment is at the time of writing out of order, water fountains are luke-warm instead of cold and the car park is a complete nightmare.

David Lloyd unfortunately does everything it can to exploit money out of its customers - I was on a platinum membership (which I didnâ€™t need) but was told to reduce a tier Iâ€™d have to pay more. That in itself goes to show how wild the payment system is. I also know the tier below donâ€™t get towels (unless they pay) despite any newer joiners paying more than me. I paid Â£160 a month, so for someone to be paying more than that and not get a towel is pretty disgusting.

For the price point everything should always be outstanding, and it just isnâ€™t. I also paid for a PT as part of my wedding prep, granted heâ€™s since left but he was continually late, or on one occasion didnâ€™t turn up at all. I did tell management this and because heâ€™d left nothing was offered as compensation for the Â£100s Iâ€™d wasted being let down by an unreliable PT. In fact I was told they would look into it and then never heard again. Just not good enough Iâ€™m afraid, so Iâ€™ve decided to take my money elsewhere. The fee is more than I paid in London for a virgin gym. Complete exploitation.
showerReviews.author: Heather Halliday

showerReviews.reviewText:
PURSE STOLEN. In the womens changing rooms I put my bag on the bench, went to the mirror to put my contact lenses in (same room), then my purse was stolen literally behind my back (yes I am that blind!). There were 3 women in the room, one of them being cleaning staff. I always lock my bag, but didnt think I needed to when Im in the same room, at a place I pay to get into! Life happens, I wasn't mad about that. I left the gym because when I told a member of staff, they had the most unbothered attitude. The first person I told passed me onto someone else. That lady told me they dont do anything without a police report. I didnt expect them to investigate, but at the very least have a log book or fill out an incident report. Very shocking.

On one of my other visits, someone had left their credit card in the vending machine. No answer on all the staff doors, and after searching for a staff member for 20 minutes, I had to bother one who was doing PT, so I could hand it in. No wonder people do as they please, staff arent availabile unless they're doing a class or PT.
showerReviews.author: Kate

showerReviews.reviewText:
Nuffield Health Gosforth is my happy place!

I have been a member for a very long time, and I wouldnâ€™t change for another venue. I use the pool, a lot, multiple time during the week and over the weekends. Itâ€™s very clean, well maintained and operated, and well designed to allow for classes and general swimming to continue, with regular notice given to any pool closures or lane closures. The lifeguards are so friendly and welcoming and make everyone feel at ease. The reception staff, gym team, and cleaning team are equally as friendly, professional and helpful and all clearly work very hard to keep the club in as best shape as possible.

I can categorically say that coming to Nuffield has helped me in my recovery, a year into being diagnosed with Relapse and Remitting MS. I have been able to come swimming as often as I want and need to, and complete my rehab training in the pool, feeling safe and happy doing so, without any judgement as i got back on my feet, and Iâ€™m fitter than I was beforehand, thanks to Nuffield. Iâ€™ve been made to feel so welcome and I genuinely look forward to my swims. Itâ€™s a super place to be a member of!

showerReviews.reviewText: Very good gym that is geared more toward bodybuilders. It has a lot of very good equipment. It's a small, family run, relatively tight knit gym where you see the same faces every time you go. Everyone there seems to be very focused and committed to bodybuilding. It's in an industrial estate, and is easily accessible by car (if you drive). A lot of money is being invested in equipment within the gym. The only suggestion I would make would be to install water chillers within the gym in several areas to refill your water bottle, The only place to do this is in the toilet within the changing rooms.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Good points:
Great gym, good level of equipment, staff are nice and friendly. Womenâ€™s only bit is great, 24 hour is convenient.

Bad points:
Bordering on oversold now itâ€™s sometimes that busy, equipment needs maintenance lots of cracking pads etc now which donâ€™t seem to be being fixed, toilet and changing room cleanliness is really poor probably should have cleaners round the clock, air con is non existent the gym is INCREDIBLY hot. Shouldnâ€™t be feeling hot in a gym in winter.

Seen a few similar reviews where response has been â€˜speak to a member of staff and let them know about toilet cleanlinessâ€™ or â€˜ask staff to turn air con downâ€™ but realistically shouldnâ€™t have to do this. Upped their prices by Â£4 a month recently, Iâ€™d expect at least clean toilets 24/7. Itâ€™s also not just hot when itâ€™s busy, itâ€™s hot all the time in all areas. Just put the air con on the lowest surely itâ€™s not that difficult?

Leaving this review as Iâ€™d currently still rate it 4* but itâ€™s going in a bit of a downward trajectory and would love to see improvement.

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is a really good gym, and best I've been to in 25 years.

I'm giving 4 star after really wanting to give 5. I'll explain:

The variety of machine is amazing, and most good quality hammer strength. I think there are 9 separate dual cable stations on the main floor (heavily used and sometimes difficult to find an empty station.)This isn't the gyms fault, it's the same in all gyms ... people love them.  This goes for the lat pull down and 3 cable row stations near the entrance. Difficult to get on, and again I think it's down to a lot of people feeling more comfortable (newbies) in the area than venturing to the play loaded section.

Changing rooms at peak times are challenging, and nothing to do with staff I think.... it's the footfall. People claim a locker and think it's theirs to use forever. People leave the toilets in disgusting state, ripping toilet dispenser off the wall. Mess on seats and floors. Customers hygiene is terrible in the changing rooms. The staff do their best but you can't constantly be cleaning up the animals mess.

I think it's mostly the students letting it down.

Could do with more toilets cubicles in the men's. 2 isn't enough for the size of the place.

It's recently got extremely busy on an evening. Almost offputting which I've never felt until the last few weeks.  If you're going to have 3 racks of dumbbells I think you need to double up on the dumbbells up to 10kg). Countless times people are waiting about for 6/8/10kg to be free. While 1 person might use 50->60kg once in a while.

How about when you sign in via qr code you get allocated a locker? It's difficult because not all phones have nfc reader to open/lock a locker with. I've seen gyms in northumberland use mifare technology via an issued card.

I can't fault the staff and job they are doing. Love the gym, the customers let it down though.
showerReviews.author: Matt Lock

Swim Benton is an outstanding swim school! The facilities are clean and well-maintained, and the atmosphere is always welcoming and encouraging. What truly sets it apart is the staffâ€”they are incredibly helpful, friendly, ensuring a structured and productive learning environment.

My daughter absolutely loves her lessons, especially with her teacher, Morgen. Morgen strikes the perfect balance between being kind and fun while maintaining a structured approach that helps kids stay focused and progress quickly. She is patient, enthusiastic, and incredibly skilled at teaching children. My daughter has made amazing strides in her swimming abilities thanks to Morgen's guidance and expertise.

I highly recommend Swim Benton to anyone looking for a top-notch swim school. They make learning to swim a fun, disciplined, and rewarding experience for both kids and parents!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Our journey with Swim! Benton began last year when we moved to East Benton area. We couldn't be more thrilled with the experience. Laura, our son's swim teacher, has been nothing short of amazing. Her engaging teaching style has captured our little one's heart, and it's evident in how much he looks forward to the swimming lessons and how his confidence in the water has flourished under Laura's guidance.

But it's not just Laura who makes Swim! Benton exceptional; the entire staff exudes friendliness and professionalism, creating a welcoming environment for both kids and parents. The facilities are top-notch, with cleanliness being a priority, and there are plenty of changing rooms to accommodate everyone comfortably.

Overall, our experience at Swim! Benton has been nothing short of fantastic. Thanks to Laura and the dedicated staff, our little one not only enjoys his swim lessons but also feels safe and supported throughout his aquatic journey. We highly recommend Swim! Benton to any parent looking for a positive and enriching swim experience for their child.

showerReviews.reviewText:
My four year old son has been attending swim Benton since April and absolutely loves going every Sunday. Thanks to his instructor Morgan, his confidence in the water has soared & you can see his progress weekly. She is fantastic with him and you can see how hard she works with her group. We always get a great hand over at the end of each lesson with what he's done well & what he can improve on.

The changing room is spotless and we love that you can see the lesson from the viewing room. Would highly recommend!
showerReviews.author: Sarah Herbert

locations.title: Bristol Lido
locations.address: îƒˆOakfield Pl, Clifton, Bristol BS8 2BJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have wanted to visit here for soooo long! Finally got the perfect excuse and brought my best friend for her birthday. We were greeted at reception and given a quick tour of the facilities. We were given a robe and a towel each and we changed into these before going up to the massage waiting room. We were collected by our massage therapists and taken into our own private rooms for the massage. The treatment was lovely and the hour passed by way too quickly! We then were taken to a relaxation are and made a cup of tea which was lovely after the massage.

I would like to offer a pro tip at this point, there was an autumnal nip in the air and we hadn't remembered to take flipflops but the floor was super chilly on the toes! If you feel the cold like I do, remember your sandals or flipflops!

After we had booked time to use the pool and facilities. We had the best time popping between the sauna, pool, hot tub, and steam room. It was never too busy in any of the areas and they were all clean. We were incredibly fortunate with the weather and it literally felt like we had gone on holiday for the day!

We hadn't booked in for lunch but the smells coming from the kitchen were making us both hungry so we asked if they took walk ins at the spa reception and the lady said yes. We popped through a little door and were in the restaurant and were seated at a lovely table in 10 mins. Our waitress was lovely and we ordered some of the small plates and some lovely refreshing drinks. The food came out relatively quickly considering how busy it was (it was peak lunch time 1.30pm) and was well presented and oh so delicious! I don't often eat out so to me the food was amazing! The tapas style food we picked was so flavourful and the perfect amount for sharing. We were recommended a delicious pudding and enjoyed every mouthful!

My friend and I have been on a few different spa days together around Bristol and this by far took the number 1 spot! Thank you to all who made our treat day so wonderful! We will be back!
showerReviews.author: Ellie Coombs

showerReviews.reviewText:
Booked an afternoon swim session here and had a fantastic time.
Swimming pool and plenty of room to swim, really nice chilled vibe too. I loved the sauna and steam room followed by the cold water bucket, certainly felt refreshing.
Hot tub was really busy but I managed to squeeze in for five minutes.
Towel hire is worth it for Â£3 because you can get a fresh towel as many times as you want, very useful.
Shower rooms were clean and had lovely shower gel and shampoo.
Will definitely be back for one of the food and swim packages, especially when the weather gets warmer.
showerReviews.author: Paul Bobo

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText: We booked the swim and breakfast package as we were spending a week in Bristol and seemed a nice thing to do . I must say we were blown away by the whole experience more queens club than David Lloydâ€™s and with bells on . This lido was refurbished and reopened to the public in 2007 . Architecturally beautiful and lovingly restored with incredible attention to detail from the pool side cubicle changing curtains to the tasteful period furniture in the upper floors . The members and staff , friendly and charming shared their special place with us and we very much appreciated . Pool , steam , sauna and jacuzzi left us refreshed and ready for breakfast. Changing rooms and shower  areas were super clean and tidy . Then to breakfast well !!! This was another level and unexpected , ibÃ©rico chop with Catalan beans duck egg , morcilla and membrillo was a Hispanic combination I would have only expected to find in heaven , congratulations to the genius who pulled that baby to the pass at menu development . As in many cases sadly wonderful food not matched by service , would you like some toast with that or anything else we can get you would have been nice and a simple upsell , regardless come to expect these things and move on albeit annoying. Having said that the food quality setting and environment made for one of the most memorable breakfast. Thank you .
showerReviews.author: GastronomÃ­a Europa

showerReviews.reviewText: We went at 6pm on a weekday in the school holidays on a warm day. There were many like us hoping to have a proper swim, but there was only one very small section of the pool separated off for this (equivalent to a lane). The area for diving was bigger. This was a shame as the pool was starting to empty out but there were still a number of children in the areas that were deep enough to swim. It is a lovely setting and the pool was very refreshing, it is unheated. There are grassy areas where you can sit if you are planning to be there for a few hours. It is definitely aimed at families. It would be nice if Bradford Council set aside the last hour of opening for adult lane swims. The changing rooms are in serious need of a revamp - 3 showers, 2 sinks, 6 cubicles, dirty and wet everywhere. For Â£11.95 a swim, they should be much better than they are. Bizarrely we were asked twice to be quiet as there was a soundbath going on in the next room - this at the end of the evening when lots of people were showering (or queuing to shower!) and changing.
showerReviews.author: C A

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have been a member since 2021. I love the community and itâ€™s the only nearby leisure centre to me, but since joining the situation at the lido has gone from bad to worse.

Fusion (lido service provider) are taking advantage of the community, running our local lido into the ground.

The centre is dirty, smells of sewage, and there are flies all over the spa area. it is completely unhygienic & unsafe.

In female locker rooms, only about half the lockers actually work. It is similar for the Men's.

gym equipment is in dire straits, with people queuing to use the stair master and treadmills, as about 80% of gym equipment doesn't work.

the spa is one of the dirtiest areas, and the steam room has only been operational about 50% of the time since 2021. the hydrotherapy pool has not been operational since 2022, and remains unclean/with dirty water lingering at the bottom (see photos taken June 25th).

the pool reportedly has a leak, and is often very dirty.

the situation at the lido is getting out of hand. it is a profitable centre but it is being run to the ground, at the detriment of our community and members.

The staff are all amazing and hold the whole place together. It  makes me sad that they have to work under pitiful conditions that could be avoided if the centre was run for the community, not profit.
showerReviews.author: Hana Conevska

Changing rooms could be cleaned and wiped down more frequently. Pound coin need for lockers outside. Cafe onsite. Can buy tickets on the Fusion app in advance Â£8 for a 50min swim session.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Before I go into this review I want to note the staff working here & the community of swimmers I spend time with are one of the key reasons I return, along with it being a 50m outdoor unheated pool which is great for cold water swimming.

Unfortunately the local council have contracted Fusion to operate the pool and facilities and they are doing an atrocious job simply milking this asset! Whilst making significant profits from the pool, they fail to maintain the facilities to an adequate standard & should have their contract revoked;

1) The bathrooms & change-rooms are dirty. The floors are filthy. Are they ever cleaned?

2) The steam room is out of operation for the 3rd time in 2 years

3) Too many machines in the gym are out of order or in disrepair.

4) The signs read â€œtemporarily out of serviceâ€ and â€œnew facilities comingâ€ but they never come. Itâ€™s just lip service.

5) Many lockers in the change room simply donâ€™t work, itâ€™s a lottery.

6) Toilets are a mission to flush, so many donâ€™t bother trying.

7) Its modern day UK and the water in the bathrooms says â€œnot drinkableâ€!

With a different operator in place this pool could actually live up to its timeout rating as #1.
showerReviews.author: Hamish Petrie

showerReviews.reviewText: Beautiful any day, but especially in the summer sun! The lido itself is well maintained and beautiful, as is the sunbathing area. showerReviews.reviewText:
Poorly run gym and spa!

The equipment is old, dirty and often unsafe. Machines broken for months and empty promises being made to paying members.
The spa area is becoming a health hazard - broken sauna benches getting haphazardly fixed, flies buzzing around, dirty and knackered loungers, smell of drainage and it's just not getting cleaned enough. Absolutely filthy around the broken jacuzzi, broken soap dispensers in dirty shower cubicles.

It could be such a lovely place to exercise and relax but, unfortunately, members across the board are getting increasingly frustrated for not being heard /taken seriously.
The lido is a money making machine and the money isn't being invested back into the facilities.
showerReviews.author: Sophia Preidel

showerReviews.reviewText: This year was the first time I have visited Lido since I came to Cheltenham. I am so happy I got the chance to enjoy such a good time, relaxing in the nice and fresh pool, doing a bit of swimming (I am not the best of swimmers, but I'll float). First two times we've been there wasn't so busy, the third time it got way busier because kids started the Summer holidays, so it was a little bit of wait in the queue, but no more than maybe 10 minutes. We did booked the tickets in advance always. There's a cafÃ© restaurant there as well where you can buy food. I've had the double cheeseburger with cheesy fries and it's a very generous portion, so make sure you have the appetite to finish it. Highly recommend it for an enjoyable family time.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Awful place. A very bad experience from start to finish. I took my children who were excited to spend a few hours there and we end up leaving in 15 minutes.

Very run down place and hygiene is not great. The pool is filled with trees leaves and ants.

They didnâ€™t allow my 7 and halt year to go on the blue slide saying the rule is 8+ while most water parks around the world look the height as this safer and staff can verify. I saw other children who were much younger and when asked the staff they said we appreciate you didnâ€™t lie like others. I didnâ€™t come across any of these rules prior on the website which meant I wasted time and money going there.

It was around 14:30 and all the sudden they shut the doors to the slides with no notice displayed or anything explained.

Steer away. Not worth a penny. I would give it 0 star.

showerReviews.reviewText: This is a huge outdoor, unheated pool. Sections of the pool, which is an irregular shape, are divided into  slides/splash area, an area for families, and a section for lane swimming. The outdoor pool is part of a leisure centre with indoor pool, but access to the outdoor pool is separate to the leisure centre and can be reached via the car park. Plenty of free parking. We went for an early morning lane swim - there were only 4 of us in the pool, so plenty of space and the local/regular swimmers made us feel really welcome (even giving us 'Friends of Aldershot Lido' swimming caps, which were a lovely souvenir of our visit). The laned section of the pool is about 25-30m & fairly deep. Pool is well maintained and lovely to see the traditional fountain in operation. Changing facilities are basic but clean & clean toilets and hot showers. Lockers available poolside, but bring padlock. Overall we really enjoyed our visit ðŸ˜Š

showerReviews.reviewText: I am a frequent visitor of the Village Gym located near in Newcastle, having been a member since March of 2023, and absolutely love it! The equipment is brilliant, the facilities (such as the steam room and sauna) are top notch and the staff are what makes it so special. An example of a member of staff, is Tommy Johnson who is a breathe of fresh air. Every time you see Tommy during a workout, he always takes the time to smile and speak to you (he knows almost everyone which shows how charismatic he is). Furthermore, Tommy does a fantastic job of keeping the menâ€™s changing rooms very clean, itâ€™s like night and day when heâ€™s working on them. A fantastic gym, a brilliant community and an even better staff member who plays a major role in it.

showerReviews.reviewText:
COOL NEW GYM!
This place used to be Xercise4Less, and it was in pretty bad shape before. But now that itâ€™s been taken over by JD Gyms, theyâ€™ve clearly spent a lot of money turning this into a super-mega gym!

The first thing youâ€™ll notice is how much space there is and the open-plan layout of the place. Itâ€™s laid out really well and itâ€™s easy to find what youâ€™re looking for â€¦ even though this place is a mammoth 24,000 sq.ft

The cardio area is all in a line and itâ€™s easy to spot where machines are free. The main part of the gym floor is full of machines and plate loaded equipment, which looks awesome from above.

They have a functional Eleiko rig area with 6 Olympic weightlifting platforms, so you wonâ€™t struggle to get on anything even at busy times. And that free weights area is massive, just look at some of the pictures!

The only things that arenâ€™t open-plan are the main studio for classes, and the cool-blue Spin room. Itâ€™s worth noting that classes are free and included in the price of membership.

The changing rooms have been upgraded, and with new lockers too, which is a bonus.

Overall for the money youâ€™re paying (currently Â£19.99 per month), itâ€™s definitely worth joining - even if youâ€™re a member of another gym already. Either cancel your old membership and join here, or just have both. Itâ€™s cheap enough!
showerReviews.author: Ninh Ly

showerReviews.reviewText:
COOL NEW GYM!
This place used to be Xercise4Less, and it was in pretty bad shape before. But now that itâ€™s been taken over by JD Gyms, theyâ€™ve clearly spent a lot of money turning this into a super-mega gym!

The first thing youâ€™ll notice is how much space there is and the open-plan layout of the place. Itâ€™s laid out really well and itâ€™s easy to find what youâ€™re looking for â€¦ even though this place is a mammoth 24,000 sq.ft

The cardio area is all in a line and itâ€™s easy to spot where machines are free. The main part of the gym floor is full of machines and plate loaded equipment, which looks awesome from above.

They have a functional Eleiko rig area with 6 Olympic weightlifting platforms, so you wonâ€™t struggle to get on anything even at busy times. And that free weights area is massive, just look at some of the pictures!

The only things that arenâ€™t open-plan are the main studio for classes, and the cool-blue Spin room. Itâ€™s worth noting that classes are free and included in the price of membership.

The changing rooms have been upgraded, and with new lockers too, which is a bonus.

Overall for the money youâ€™re paying (currently Â£19.99 per month), itâ€™s definitely worth joining - even if youâ€™re a member of another gym already. Either cancel your old membership and join here, or just have both. Itâ€™s cheap enough!
showerReviews.author: Ninh Ly

Cancelled recently as gym took a sharp downturn.  Hygiene standards and cleanliness are awful.

Having the gym piping hot, super busy, no anti-bac spray, and not a cleaner to be seen, is just not a place for me.

Also blocking out the only natural light coming in with the new frosted screens on the windows makes it feel even more disgusting tbh.

Also removing cardio equipment for more weight machines I donâ€™t like, itâ€™s an 80% weights gym now.

Sad really, was a good gym after Covid, standards have dropped to rock bottom now.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Well I thought id use a truckstop this evening and I headed off to Sandy Lane truckstop.

Â£25 a night isnt bad i thought! But then...

Its unmanned, unsecured, floodlights broken, no cafe/restaurant. And there isnt a ladies toilet or shower (that isnt also used by men). But what we do have is the men's toilet that theyve saved the end stall just for us girls. But we gotta walk past 3 urinals before I get to our toilet. When I arrive, not to my surprise, there was shit on the walls and stained the porcelain! Only hot water from one tap.

So its safe to say I left, id rather a layby than paying to see someone's old man!
showerReviews.author: Katie Boulton

showerReviews.reviewText:
Negative points first.

The site is. Advertised has secure parking, which it certainly is not, only 2 out of 8 floodlights working, no security at all, this includes no guard, no security fencing, no access barriers.

Positives

Even though the toilets and showers are inside building site units/containers, they are hot and clean.

No hot food onsite but there is a Greggs/Shell/Londis garage next door.

Honest opinion and room for improvement

Â£25 for the night to be honest over priced

The site could be a brilliant truck park if the security measures where in place, plus there is a boarded up takeaway unit which looks like it would make a brilliant cafe
showerReviews.author: Brian Mayers

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely amazing place. Yes it's get full fast, yes it's on a slope  in some places..... but.... food is absolutely winner 10/10

Top price (as you have a few options) is Â£35 with Â£12 food voucher. Other options  are for Â£6/Â£31  and so on. Â£ 12  feed you everything  from menu apart from fully monty grill  Â£15.95
Food menu is massive,including  burgers,curry,kebabs,home made pizza sandwiches  and so on. Food is awesome!  Trucker next to me said they try to kill you with the size of those portions. I saw different  platters out and all was great and when ask all said amazing. So a big shout out to a kitchen staff!

All place  very clean and tidy, don't forget to take token for a shower(7min plenty enough)  shower  room with massive space and regulated temperature of water ðŸ˜ŽðŸ’¦ðŸ˜ so in summer - winner.

Staff mostly  very friendly  and kind, one bad egg but it might  be not his day so I won't  blame or judge  his life  on that. We all had it.

If by any  chance  I will be around, even  for a sneaky 45 I will be there!

I would recommend it 100%

The mushrooms chicken was not cooked enough, I didnâ€™t send it back because it was impossible to do anything about it after that and I didnâ€™t want to find some â€˜spicesâ€™ added. They couldnâ€™t provide me the bank card receipt which I needed. And the showers are good, but they should have start/stop buton, especially for women, 7-8 minutes it is not enough, or at least it should play the sound one minute before ending, not when the water stops so we are able to rinse.

showerReviews.reviewText:
First time visit to Onroute Truckstop Jcn 29 of the M1. First of all a congratulations to all the staff on site, I engaged with ground staff who were at the fuel pumps, shop staff, the catering team in the restaurant and visited the truck wash.

On arrival, my purpose of the visit was to refuel, quick shower, some breakfast and wash my truck. All of which were the result of my eroute @SNAP app. Fuel pumps were easily accessible with over head canopy at 5m height restriction.

Keyfuels, UK fuels and Silvey Fuel cards accepted with loads of information boards encouraging you to sign up to the Onroute app and collect loyalty points which can be reclaimed onsite as discounts towards purchases, and 50% off your first restaurant order. A few minutes later my app was installed and breakfast ordered whilst stood at the fuel pumps!

Parked up and next on the agenda was a quick shower. Straight into the shower block which was spotlessly clean on entry with a separate changing and drying area. A bit old school but better than trying to dress on a wet floor. Striped off and wondered into the shower cubicle to find a vending machine at the shower with a notice to buy a token from the shop at Â£2.50 for the pleasure. I was sorely tempted to walk back out naked to get my token but decided as time was of the essence and my breakfast was being cooked, to dismiss the shower for now. Perhaps moving the notice to the shower door would be advised? As a result no review to the showers or the hot water, but looking at the shower curtains, stained and tired looking, weâ€™ll leave that there.

The shop staff, stock available and friendly engagement was first class. I picked up some Tacho rolls and paid via Apple Pay at the till and was given a receipt without asking. Conversations were flowing and a happy environment - 10/10.

In the foyer and just outside the front door with the usual slot machines and laundry facilities, all working and available for use.  Plenty more information on hand about facilities on offer and selection of advertising.

Into the restaurant and again a joyful atmosphere with happy staff and a greeting by another member of staff ensuring I had downloaded the Onroute app and even offered me a fuel card application for silvey - nice touch. Food was presented bang on time as per the app order, was piping hot and further enquiries if I needed anything else, which I didnâ€™t. They catered for everything. Very well done 10/10.

After breakfast I retired with my coffee to the seating area outside for my cigarette and the smoking area was fully accessible, clean and tidy.

Finally the truck wash, which was the purpose of the visit. I departed Driffield in Yorkshire on route to the South West and my collected trailer was black. It was supposed to be white!  Logging into the Snap app my first available truck wash on route was here. So this was a fairly integral part of my visit. You can imagine my disappointment to pull up and find it abandoned and closed. 0/10

All in all, not a bad experience, not sure if the truck wash is permanently closed but itâ€™s let the site down in its overall scores.
showerReviews.author: Casper Roe-Lavery

locations.title: Westerhope Filling Station
locations.address: îƒˆStamfordham Rd, Westerhope, Newcastle upon Tyne NE5 2LD, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Definitely not going back there, customer service is just plain awful.

The car wash dryer wasn't working, so the member of staff suggested the basic wash.
Drove the car into the car wash, which stopped working mid-way through the wash. Called the member of staff over to reset the system. They said it stopped because I have a tow bar, and that I should not get it washed in the drive-through. There were absolutely no signs or indications to suggest that the drive-through car wash machine is not suitable for cars with a tow bar attached.
I asked if I could get a refund, given that my car cannot be washed. They refused, saying it's essentially my fault for having a tow bar. No thought given to the lack of information during the mis-selling.

Definitely not going back there, customer service is just plain awful.
showerReviews.author: B T

Facilities - Generally pretty good, toilets could use a bit more cleaning overnight but otherwise on a par with most decent Truckstops. Has a gym for drivers (terrifying!!!!)
Bosses - Money grabbing nasty people.

Â£25 to park for the night - no food voucher.
Â£20 spent in the shop.
Â£10 spent in subway.
Want to charge me for a shower too??? Nah thanks. There are free showers no more than an hour away in every direction.

Purely for this Iâ€™ll stop elsewhere in future. If they think they can monetise personal hygiene I donâ€™t want to deal with them.

showerReviews.reviewText: I dropped my bike into motech ..it was there three weeks. With no updates given, unless I rang the garage. If it wasn't under warranty I would have had a Â£1200 bill. Where my bike returned with a fresh scratch through one of the stickers. Missing gromits holding the fairing together and every fibre washer was overtightened and most split. Coming from an apparent aprilia dealer. You'd think care and attention would have been given to a bike with 4000 mile on the clock. And if anything was damaged or split should have been replaced. I'm digusted at the level of craftsmanship and customer care given by this establishment . In the future I shall travel to Thirsk to the dealer there.
showerReviews.author: stephen Young

showerReviews.reviewText: Used this service before for my tacho breaks, but last night decided to park up overnight. First of all parking spaces design are waste of space, if someone parks in the middle of the bay they have no chance to get out unless someone in the front or back leave parking space. Showers are not good as well, water runs for good 5 seconds and stops, not good enough to wash hands. First overnight stay and had my curtain slashed, so seems like won't be stopping here no more. Cost so much to park, but no security cameras or security patrol.

locations.title: Moto Blyth
locations.address: îƒˆHill Top Roundabout, A1(M), A614 S81 8HG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: What can I say that hasn't already been said? Well let me start with this, there is ample room for walking your dog,  fairly large amount of undulating terrain arranged in such a way that simulates a reasonable route around half the perimeter of the services itself. Granted it's not particularly scenic but it's next to a motorway so what do you expect? The rolling hills of Scotland? Furthermore I found the inside of the service station to be exactly as I've come to expect from a services. Unfortunately nothing sets it apart from the others but that's not to say there's anything wrong with it. I had a burger king meal, someone tried to claim it as their own when the number was called out but I can't put that on the service station, the good lady had a wrap from M&S which was likely fine. I've marked the services down a star because I used the wash room and found the smell to be rather pungent, of unrine. Now this isn't uncommon I know and probably expected, I'm willing to review this later on in life when I return. But until then it's a soild 4. Which does put in it my top 10 of services in the UK (northern half) Stay say.
showerReviews.author: Ed Manley

showerReviews.reviewText: Iâ€™ve been asked to elaborate on my rating and in fairness, I should have done so originally. Arriving on a wet busy Twixmas afternoon, the service station was really busy, floors wet, tables needed a clean down and the general feeling was pretty meh. That said, I can imagine on a warm summers day with more people sitting outside it may have an entirely different feeling to the place. But our visit, on this day, was just a bit meh. Long queue to get into the car park to find there were in fact lots of spaces but the layout meant people parking caused tailbacks. Three staff wearing hi vis, apparently there to assist with parking, standing doing nothing. Two on their phones, one standing with a sign stating Spaces Here but not holding it aloft meant no one could see it.  The bathrooms were wet and there were papers littered on the floor in the cubicle, with a wet seat and not in the best condition as a result. Weâ€™ve all been there, and even hourly checks would have struggled to keep the cloakrooms up to scratch on a wet busy day, and ultimately, itâ€™s down to the users to make an effort. Visited the food shop and grabbed a burger meal (dry burger and bland fries)and staff were pretty indifferent.  The service station itself provided a service but itâ€™s a splash and dash, not one I would want to take a break at, particularly compared with others on the same south to north road trip.
showerReviews.author: Lorna W

locations.title: Moto Southwaite Northbound
locations.address: îƒˆ41 and 42, M6 northbound between Junction, Carlisle CA4 0NT, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: We made a comfort stop here on a long coach journey north. It's an average sized services with ample parking space for both cars and heavy vehicles, and a good choice of food outlets: Burger King, KFC, Costa, Pret a Manger, plus a Greggs and a Cornish pasty van out the back, and a decent sized M&S Food and WH Smith. Plenty of indoor seating. The only letdown was the toilets; the facilities were modern and there were plenty of cubicles, but they were decidedly smelly and did not look as though they were being cleaned often enough. On the positive side, there was a great selection of snack foods at M&S. I bought a chicken sandwich, pork pie and drink to take on the coach. The food was very fresh and good quality, and the lady who took my payment was both helpful and friendly.
showerReviews.author: Valerie Hinchliffe

locations.address: îƒˆ48 Osborne Rd, Jesmond, Newcastle upon Tyne NE2 2AL, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: My first time visiting Jesmond City Retreat and I will definitely be returning. Catherine welcomed me warmly and when shown to our treatment room she provided me with a detailed itinerary for my appointment. The room was the perfect temperature, with relaxing decor, mood lighting with traditional spa background music. I thoroughly relaxed under the warm towels for a full body scrub and drizzling of oils which invigorated muscles and skin perfectly. A wonderful light facial scrub was followed by a well pressurised hot shower and a final drizzling of body oils. Catherine made me feel relaxed and completely pampered.
showerReviews.author: Elain Alex

Clean bathrooms and showers available as well.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great location about 5 min walk from the station and right in the centre of Newcastle. Stayed here for the Great North Run so it was quite busy. Had a good communal area and kitchen. A small issue was that there was no internet connection in the rooms, but that didnâ€™t really bother me.
The rooms are clean and everyone has a good size locker and access to multiple toilets and showers on each floor.

The best thing about this place was the staff, incredibly friendly and helpful! Couldnâ€™t fault them at all. Thanks

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very friendly and helpful staff ! Showers and toilets were quite clean but the floor of the room could have been cleaner. There was also a weird smell in the corridors and in the room.
As a solo traveller I did not feel safe in the common areas. The kitchen was very dirty, the common areas were monopolised by men who acted in a disgusting manner and gave weird looks.
The hostel felt dead, I did not enjoy my time there. It was very close to the train station though.
Overall I would not recommend.

locations.title: Budget Hostel
locations.address: îƒˆ90 Shields Rd, Byker, Newcastle upon Tyne NE6 1DL, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: The place a dump no breakfast just a microwave smells no heating damp showers toilets not cleaned bed not good so bad I will never go back at that place again
showerReviews.author: John Fletcher

showerReviews.reviewText: The place a dump no breakfast just a microwave smells no heating damp showers toilets not cleaned bed not good so bad I will never go back at that place again
showerReviews.author: John Fletcher

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have never in my life stayed at a worse place than this one. And I have seen many bad places.

Their advertising is nothing but lies. I called one of the employees out about it and he literally denied every issue I listed and implied I am a liar and that there is nothing wrong with the place and nothing was lied about. Well I have images to prove at least what I can prove.

Many people don't speak out, but they should. This places should be closed down, and I was told by the other hostel where I escaped to from this dump, that they also violate regulations by law.

So let's start:

-Outside it was around 10C or less over night and the rooms were not heated! Not on any day. Me and the woman in the bed next to me we slept in our winter coats and we were still cold.
- The place looks run down, I was joking that it looks like a homeless shelter/jail/military camp but I am sure all those are at least heated and in a better condition
- The entire place smells like a porter potty, and I am not exaggerating, it's absolutely disgusting
- The place is dirty and not taken care of
- No towels. They told me to go to Morrisons and buy one. (when I confronted the employee, he said that's not true I should have asked for it. I did. And I was told to buy one.)
- No one at the front desk, at any time.
- You have to check in through the off license store next door, no employees in the "hostel"
- I was gone for a day but didn't check out and they gave my bed away.
- The mattresses are more like spring boxes, you feel every spring and they might be from 1970.
- The bedding looked like crap, who knows if they even wash them
- The whole place is a dump.
- The area Byker, is the worst are in the greater Newcastle area
- no hot water in the sinks
- rude staff (from across the shop)

I was in a rush when booking and put my faith in Hostelworld.com, I should have seen the reviews before hand. I hope you do. Avoid this place at any cost. I went to another hostel which was cheaper and looked like a luxury hotel compared to this one.

PS the mirror picture, look at the mirror how dirty it is.
showerReviews.author: SZ S

showerReviews.reviewText: You get what you pay for :) Stayed here before the great north run. The room was ok for one night, but next time I'd probably go for something better.. There was no one at the reception, other guests let me in after knocking and trying to call the phone # on the app a couple of times. The room and the bed was generally clean, the shower / toilet is borderline. I left really early so I saw no people at the reception when leaving either. I guess it was ok for one night, but if you can afford something better, then go for it. If not, then just don't expect anything..
showerReviews.author: Daniel Turi

showerReviews.reviewText:
Would give the manager an 15/10, was so lovely and had some great recommendations for my trip that I was going on!!! I paid Â£7/Â£8 as theyâ€™re recovering from covid which is about right but wouldnâ€™t pay anything more! Itâ€™s a hostel bed for a few nights so that price was okay.
(No covid precautions so recommend giving it a careful thought if ur worried about that before booking)

No one was ever at the reception desk but was offered a number if I needed anything as thereâ€™s people that would help me from downstairs or across the road so not much of a bother.
The hostel itself... it was secure in the fact it had a number password lock on the front door and a few small lockers in the hallway and obviously lock on loo doors but that was it. It was said they had gotten rid of all the trouble makers that have been placed in due to covid when I arrived. Still had some questionable characters living semi-long term (awaiting documents, on their way somewhere else or other personal reasons) this included a couple of drunks which is always a little worrying (especially when Iâ€™m getting a life talk at 9am when Iâ€™m trying to leave) but luckily I got on with the people in my dorm as they were nice. The first night the female toilet had no toilet roll, smelt of sewage and had water (I hope) along the floor edge by the pipe which wasnâ€™t there the next afternoon which was good but still smelt a bit. The shower I just avoided as it didnâ€™t look the nicest to say the least. The top room had little ventilation so often smelt and was quite stuffy. The duvet had to be quite old as it was all thin and bobbly and definitely needed renewing.
The hostel itself definitely has potential and Iâ€™m sure has had better days before my arrival, I think the price I paid is reasonable for what the hostel was, a bed for a few nights.
showerReviews.author: Chloe Green

locations.title: Sleeperdorm
locations.address: îƒˆ52 Elswick Rd, Newcastle upon Tyne NE4 6JH, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I stayed at this hotel for one night in one of the en-suite rooms. After I made the booking, I was concerned with so many negative reviews on google and was very apprehensive about my stay. But I was pleasantly surprised when I reached the hotel.

The room was decent size, clean and well ventilated. The bed was comfortable and bedding was adequate.

There is a desk, small smart TV and free wi-fi. No other facilities like kettle etc.

Bath was clean. There was no towel or shower gel but I was carrying it with me so no issues on that end.

The person at reception called me and confirmed my arrival time. They were at the reception when I reached and helped take my luggage to the room. The room has a card key access, with lock from inside, so felt secure.

The parking at front is limited but I got a space for me. There are other streets nearby where its a free parking area.

Overall, a pleasant stay for single traveller for one night.

Only minor issue was that the water pressure in shower was low.
showerReviews.author: Manoj Kulkarni

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed here at the weekend and the owner is the hotel owner version of a shady landlord. Firstly if you're early, you're paying Â£10 per hour you're early despite the room being ready. Next, you're paying Â£25 bank transfer PER PERSON deposit. Expect to never see this money again. Checkout is at 10am, I guarantee there will be nobody on the desk. We had to leave our room key card on the reception desk after 20 minutes of waiting. another group was also waiting and had been for some time (they had paid their deposit in cash). Owner phoned, "checked cameras" which is obviously untrue, and I didn't leave the key card. Just a way to scam people of deposit money. Ultimately I will say the room was clean and the beds were comfy, the shower is literally unusable but this place is fine for a night, provided you don't mind paying Â£25 extra per person, because you will never see that money again. AVOID and book somewhere less dodgy.
showerReviews.author: Sloppychops69

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed here for two nights over Saturday and Sunday in August 2025. The location is great and the room was cheap. There is lots of noise outside and the street is very busy over the weekend the windows are single glazing so does nothing to stop the noise. If you want to know how many emergency service vehicles are dispatched in Newcastle stay here, you hear them all night long and they dont turn the sound of sirens off at night! All the doors bang so when people come late and it wakes you at all hours. The sunlight shines pretty much all day, there is only a roller blind which does not block out the light, the bed is right beside the window so can be hard to sleep. Not the room advertised as there was no sofa or ironing facilities. But as I say, it was cheap and close to the centre. The room itself was reasonably clean with fresh towels and the management were accommodating allowing us to stay in the room until 4pm for a small fee. Also there is only 1 light, the main bed room light either on or off lol.
showerReviews.author: Jason Brady

showerReviews.reviewText: Fantastic campsite, we loved our weekend here. Paul and Gillian, the owners, are so helpful and friendly and have done a fantastic job of creating a relaxing site. The pitches are huge and really spread out amongst the long grass so it felt really peaceful. I was a bit nervous about the composting toilets but they worked fine and the hot showers were excellent. The friendly alpacas kept the kids entertained and the fact itâ€™s only a five minute walk to the Running Fox cafe and shop is a huge bonus. Will definitely be returning.

showerReviews.reviewText: Fantastic campsite, we loved our weekend here. Paul and Gillian, the owners, are so helpful and friendly and have done a fantastic job of creating a relaxing site. The pitches are huge and really spread out amongst the long grass so it felt really peaceful. I was a bit nervous about the composting toilets but they worked fine and the hot showers were excellent. The friendly alpacas kept the kids entertained and the fact itâ€™s only a five minute walk to the Running Fox cafe and shop is a huge bonus. Will definitely be returning.
showerReviews.author: Robert Scott

showerReviews.reviewText:
Such a beautiful place. The campsite is outstanding, different pitching areas over a large field. There is the option to stay in the shepherds hut if you like, but I'd recommend the camping. Showers, sinks, toilets and a urinal and also a small hut with games and books in to keep yourselves busy.
Lots of local walks, but beware of the hills when out for a walk.
On the campsite, the owners have alpacas, sheep and chickens and there are a couple of barn owls that live on the site.
Practically on the site is St Wilfrid Church, a lovely 14th century church with lots of history.
Overall, thoroughly recommend ðŸ‘ðŸ»ðŸ‘ðŸ»

Absolutely fantastic camp site.
The grass is well maintained, ground is soft.

The views and the tranquility here really make it an exceptional place to visit especially when looking for a 'dark skies' site to watch meteor showers or general star gazing.
Facilities are great, proper flushing toilets and probably the best hot water shower I have used on a camp site.
Thank you, i will visit again soon
