showerReviews.reviewText:
Wellâ€¦. I donâ€™t know where to start.
Iâ€™ve given this site one star but even that is being too generous.
A trailer pulled into a field with mobile toilets and a shower fitted on top doesnâ€™t really cut it. The facilities were that basic it was untrue.
Due to a massive blockage in the sewage system as we arrived the menâ€™s toilets backed up and were out of action for the whole time that we were there so the men had to share the ladies portable trailer toilets and one shower and even one of those toilets was out of action so we were down to two for the whole site.
I might also add that the single hand sink only had cold water and there were no washing up facilities whatsoever.
I will say in the owners defence that she came across as a lovely person but Iâ€™m quite sure that if she holidayed at someoneâ€™s campsite she would certainly expect better than she is offering her guests.
I personally having stayed at many many campsites across the country this site doesnâ€™t come upto anywhere near what is expected.
I was glad to pack up in the morning and leave as quick as possible.
showerReviews.author: Carol Higham

showerReviews.reviewText: This is a great caravan park. Touring pitches are generous, with hook ups and water 'on tap'. Toilets, and showers are some of the best we've ever found, always kept in tip top condition. Located next to the sea front, near the park, shops, and Metro. It's a fantastic site, friendly staff, with a quiet neighbours, which we try to visit every year. Just a shame it closes at the end of November, or we'd be back sooner.

locations.title: West Wood Yurts
locations.address: îƒˆGibside, Cut Thorn Farm, Burnopfield, Newcastle upon Tyne NE16 6AA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
What a beautiful place! Rose lodge has everything you could need for your convenience. On arrival, we were impressed with how immaculate the lodge was and how amazing it smelled.
The mattress and pillows are of great quality and so comfortable and the shower is fantastic. The kitchen area has been expertly done; it has everything you could need.
The attention to detail shows a real labour of love, with the comfort of the inside matched by the outside. Pretty solar lights illuminated the hot tub as we watched the sun set, a fire pit provides a warm glow as the chill of the night descends, and the benefit of a covered porch with chairs offers solace from the wind while still enjoying the views covered by the cosy blanket provided.
With walking access to Gibside, it really is the perfect getaway to enjoy the peace and quiet of the countryside and explore the local area. We miss the sheep already!
showerReviews.author: Gemma Cooper

showerReviews.reviewText:
It's a great site, located within easy walking distance from Beamish, if you're OK with climbing hills!  The modern toilet block is spacious and clean, other amenities include a pot washing and food prep area, Elsan, kiddies play area, shop and bar.

Do be aware that the roads leading to the site and between the site and Beamish museum are narrow and winding and there are no footpaths at the side of the road, so be extra careful on route.

showerReviews.reviewText: Lovely basic campsite. Lovely friendly family who run it. Relaxed check in. You more or less get to set up tent where you want, they just point you in the right direction. Electric hook up available if wanted. There's showers, toilets, wash room, washer, dryer and a games room with vending machine. People have complained about it being dirty and outdated etc....it's not the cleanest or most modern site but it's a basic site and you're only paying Â£6 pp pn. I didn't have a problem with it at all. If I want modern and sparkly clean I wouldn't go camping!! Dogs are welcome. It's a busy working farm so do expect tractors etc to go trundling past throughout the day/evening. There's a nice pub just a few minutes drive away that serves good beer and great food. Corbridge is about 10 minutes drive....typical little town with co-op pubs eating places quirky shops, vets etc. All you need to take back to your tent/caravan! I loved my stay here and will definitely be back!
showerReviews.author: Callysrainbow

showerReviews.reviewText: The best campsite we have ever stayed at. Amazing space for facilities for the dog. Baths in the female washroom. No push button shower which is really handy when washing hair etc. Please make use of the sauna we wished we done it sooner. loved hand feeding the animals. Pizza delivered to our pitch on Friday. showerReviews.reviewText: We stayed as a couple in a basic pod. It was lovely and warm, we didn't need the radiator at all despite it being October. Bed was comfortable and we brought our own sheets. The fridge, toaster and microwave was all really helpful for a bite to eat in the evening and at breakfast. We saw some fairy lights around the front of the pod but didn't realise until later that we could have paid for the power source for these - they looked lovely on other pods and helpful for finding the pod on the way back from the toilet so would do this next time! The site itself was lovely to walk around with stunning views and animals. Other visitors were quiet and friendly. The amenities block was very clean with modern toilets and showers. There was also a dishwashing room with board games, sinks and vending machines which was useful for washing up in the morning. Overall we had a very comfortable stay and would love to come back and bring the kids as they would have loved the playground and animals - next time we will look to book one with a hot tub! Thanks for a great stay.
showerReviews.author: Candice H

showerReviews.reviewText:
These pods are superb - well equipped and warm.
We'd booked to stay there for the dark skies and star gazing. Unfortunately it was a cloudy week! But we took advantage of the hot tub and log pit.
There is plenty to do in the area - Hadrians wall, sycamore gap, Vindolanda fort and village, kielder forest and the list goes on. At Kielder Forest we did their zip wire (a roller coaster of a zip wire!) and archery. Great fun.
I've marked them down only because the fairy lights that are strung around the outside of the pod were inaccessible and apparently only come with the birthday package! Surely they don't use much electricity.  If they were on all the time and the skies were clear they would have spoilt the dark skies - a separate switch would have overcome that.
They only thing missing was a rack to hang our damp towels on.
Great stay and would recommend.
showerReviews.author: Jan Morton

showerReviews.reviewText:
These pods are superb - well equipped and warm.
We'd booked to stay there for the dark skies and star gazing. Unfortunately it was a cloudy week! But we took advantage of the hot tub and log pit.
There is plenty to do in the area - Hadrians wall, sycamore gap, Vindolanda fort and village, kielder forest and the list goes on. At Kielder Forest we did their zip wire (a roller coaster of a zip wire!) and archery. Great fun.
I've marked them down only because the fairy lights that are strung around the outside of the pod were inaccessible and apparently only come with the birthday package! Surely they don't use much electricity.  If they were on all the time and the skies were clear they would have spoilt the dark skies - a separate switch would have overcome that.
They only thing missing was a rack to hang our damp towels on.
Great stay and would recommend.

locations.title: Bloody Bridge Campsite
locations.address: îƒˆ35 Ballagh Rd, Newcastle BT33 0LA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
As a wild camper I always did tend to avoid camp sites as a preference. However I (we, fellow wild camping mates) have fallen in love with this place!
It is a perfect pitch with fantastic views of the Sea no matter where you pitch. The site is layered back up from the the foot of the mountain for maximum views and accessibility.
The site is well protected, gated and security around the clock. It is very safe and well managed. It's the perfect base as well for those of you who like to venture - Swimming in the Sea, swimming in the lakes or rock pools, hiking among the Mourne mountains.
This place is so near perfect I have been twice in recent weeks and looking to go again before the end of the month, availability dependent.
The nearby town of Newcastle, Co Down is also a great spot for strolling, shopping and even a couple of pints listening to live music if you fancy a night out.
showerReviews.author: Jason Cauldwell

showerReviews.reviewText:
We have just spent two nights at Millstone and it was really lovely.
We were the only ones on site, due to it being midweek, the facilities were great, the toilet block houses three toilets, two with showers, there is a third shower room at the back of the block with a separate entrance. All were a great size and very clean. There is an outside kitchen area to do your washing up, itâ€™s surrounded by Aloe Vera so had a very tropical feel about it. The view is beautiful! The campsite is terraced so everyone is able to see the stunning vista. Caroline and Des were wonderful hosts, easily contactable before hand and if we had any questions while we were there. Its location to Newcastle and the surrounding areas is fantastic. Highly recommend, we will be back.
showerReviews.author: Katie Noon

showerReviews.reviewText:
My friends and I had a super time at Bloody Bridge Campsite. We cmaped in tents and we also had a camper van. The location is fantastic, a 5 min drive from Newcastle town, and 10 mins from both Tollymore Forest Park and Castlewellan park. Just 2 mins up the road is a spot to do some rock pool swimming (recommended by Caroline our host). Caroline and Desy were so welcoming and lovely. They were there if we needed them , which we didn't as everything that we needed was there. Clean toilet facilities, plenty of power sockets and some picnic benches to have your morning coffee and snacks.

The views from the campsite are stunning and because all the campers are nestled in amongst the trees it didn't feel like you were on top of your neighbour.

Good value for money too at Â£30 per night for a 4-man tent. Would highly recommend this campsite in an absolutely beautiful area near the Mourne Mountains. :-)
showerReviews.author: Fiona Kearney

locations.title: Parkdean Resorts Whitley Bay Holiday Park, Tyne & Wear
locations.address: îƒˆHoliday Park, Blyth Rd, Whitley Bay NE26 4RR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Got such great great memories of this place growing up! Been going here for 37 years and
Although so much has changed and it had so much more in years gone by it is still a lovely place to visit. It is very very close to my heart! When I first used to go there it was called feathers and it had an on-site bar called the lighthouse club and it also had a big evening entertainment club called the galleon with a bar upstairs. It had an onsite arcade and games place with outdoor electric trikes for children. The staff were lovely especially the lady I will always remember from the on-site fish & chip shop. You of course had the permanent theme park too at Spanish city ! Was such a beautiful place. Have been for a while but planning to get up there next year so I can now pass on memories and take my child as my mum & dad did for me. The Geordies are just the most beautiful people in the world ! Always friendly and always have time for ya. I remember when the big ship caught fire out at sea and washed up on the beach at seaton sluice. I was actually up at this holiday park when it happened. Canâ€™t wait to get back and visit. A very special place !
showerReviews.author: N Alexander

showerReviews.reviewText:
Just spent 3 nights here in our tourer.
Gordon the warden is friendly and very helpful. Even when he is busy keeping the site clean and tidy he still makes time to chat or answer any queries.
We stayed on a grass pitch with electric,  we was allowed to position our van to suit us, cars can be parked next to van. Price included 4 people. Dogs made welcome, and there is a feild that's 3/4 enclosed and can play off lead. We had a great stay, everyone staying at same time as us were all friendly and chatty. Would recommend this site.
People have left negative comments on the toilet block but Gordon has informed us the owners have taken the comments seriously and have started preparations for a new toilet / shower  block to be built.
At present the female toilet block has 2 toilets and 1 very big, spacious shower.
Mens has 1 of each. This may be old but its kept clean and all amenities work well.
showerReviews.author: Sharon Jickells

locations.title: Finchale Abbey Residential & Touring Park
locations.address: îƒˆFinchale Caravan Park, Brasside, Durham DH1 5SH, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The shower and toilet block was lovely, very clean, warm and had lots of cubicles and showers.
Personally, I didn't like the site. It felt very crowded with touring vans, wood lodges and a couple of shepherd's huts all crammed in with very little space between. It also felt a bit impersonal with the online booking quickly followed with about 4 or 5 emails with rules and information such as the code which is used to gain entry to the site and the shower block, so we never dealt with an actual person.
showerReviews.author: Viv Hammond

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
Spent a couple of nights here in the van. Very nice peaceful site midweek with an easy cycle route into Durham which could be done on foot aswell, although it does sort of take you through the middle of the prison at one point!
Some pitches look OK but most are far from level, and the hard standing ones are only just big enough to fit a small van on so be prepared so do some serious levelling (chocks are provided)
Facilities block is very good and kept very clean. Showers are a good size and you get a decent time length from the push button.
It's all done remotely with entry details sent via email so you don't have a personal greeting, and the reception isn't obvious as it looks like it's part of the Abbey set up. But once you find it there are some interesting leaflets and if you need wifi you can get it there but not on the site.
showerReviews.author: Mike Halliwell

locations.title: Brockwell Woods Wild Camping at Blaydon Burn Farm
locations.address: îƒˆBlaydon Burn Farm, Burn Rd, Blaydon-on-Tyne NE21 6JR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great wild camping experience - great for the kids - lovely woods to explore and spacious. Friendly owners - forest school areas a bonus for the kids.  True wild camping - will definitely be back first visit July 2024.

Returned July 2025 - what an amazing place this is!! The woods are great to explore nature and the outdoors. We booked for 2 nights (Saturday & Sunday) for 3 adults and 6 children and it was a great stay had by all - We was warmly welcomed by Steph who happened to be chatting near the camping check in area upon our arrival and even washed out and refilled our water tank (Thank You). Check in is simple and straight forward no hassle arrive, check in, leave cash in envelope provided, collect map and make way to your allocated pitch. We was allocated 5B which was very easy to find and a large pitch near to the forest school area which the kids loved. we all had a great time and will definitely be a regular visitor to this amazing place - This is proper WILD camping experience no toilet facilities available on site (We take a portable toilet and tent).
showerReviews.author: Matthew Jeacock

Parking is at the Sandgate Car Park at the back of the Hotel and was reasonably priced. The location of the Hotel is at the Quayside in a beautiful building. Would definitely return and recommend to others.

locations.title: INNSiDE by MeliÃ¡ Newcastle
locations.address: îƒˆRiverview, Bridge Court, Newcastle upon Tyne NE1 3BE, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Well what started as a bad experience was quickly sorted by the excellent staff.

We won a nights stay at the INNSiDE Newcastle and on our way driving up we got a call from the PR agency saying there was a mis-communication and we actually had no room to stay in.

As part of the prize was to see the Royal Northern Sinfonia we needed somewhere to change, the PR agency said there was no where to change but we would be able to use the toilets to get changed when we arrived. However this still meant we had nowhere to spend the night.

On arrival we spoke to staff, who understandably were confused by the whole thing, they confirmed the PR agency failed to actually book a room.

However, the staff were excellent they said go take a seat we'll get you some drinks and we will sort it out. They sure did they managed to find is a room in a very nice suite overlooking the river Tyne.  They even arranged for an extra bed for our son in the room.

When we got to the room it was clean and well laid out, with a huge bed and tea coffee facilities, plus complimentary drink in the fridge. One thing I really liked was the TV was a nice modern smart TV with things like streaming, YouTube, etc all built it, which makes a change from other hotels I have stayed in.

The room layout was good, fantastic view of the river and the really weird kinda open plan bathroom. The sink was in the room at one end and the shower was also in the room. The actual only sealed off room was the toilet. A weird and actually quite nice layout.

Now the only down side is parking, there are limited spaces and it's actually the most expensive place to park in Newcastle Â£18 for 24 hours, so whilst it's convenient for the hotel it's not cheap.

But all in all a really nice experience. So if you are looking for a hotel in Newcastle go for the INNSiDE and you won't be disappointed.
showerReviews.author: Sean

locations.title: Sunderland Aquatic Centre
locations.address: îƒˆStadium Park, Monkwearmouth, Sunderland SR5 1SU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Visited for the 50m olympic size pool and wasn't disappointed! Used the Everyone Active app, which I already had an account with, so booking was relatively easy, and comparatively good value for money at Â£5.95 for an adult swim. The 50m pool was only available on Saturday or Wednesday when we booked - I guess the rest of the week it's divided into 2x25m - but the app made this clear. Parking was easy (and free) at the stadium car park opposite. Reception staff were helpful. Changing rooms were clean, plenty of cubicles, toilets, lockers (Â£1 returnable or bring your own padlock) and warm showers. There were only 2 of us in the slow lane (the faster lanes seemed busier) on the Saturday afternoon session. Pool is well-maintained and slightly warmer than most competition pools I've swam in. 4 lifeguards who were attentive throughout the session. Definitely worth a visit ðŸ‘Œ
showerReviews.author: Anya Chapman

showerReviews.reviewText:
Can't fault the facilities, but I was shocked at the level of cleanliness in the communal changing room.  The floors needs a proper deep clean, as do the the independent showers. The pong was unreal.

As the the individual changing pods, I had to go into three separate ones before I found one that didn't smell like urine.  And even then the ones I picked has dirt & lime scale stains in them, as well as what looked like cobwebs right up high.

Finally all of all of the drainage drains where clogged with hair balls, leaving standing water in them.

Basically, I had a great time in the pool but the experience either side quite honestly left me feeling dirty.  Which is never a nice feeling.
showerReviews.author: O Ickhaw

All in all a great place for family fitness *(and significantly cheaper than David Lloyds)

showerReviews.reviewText:
Attended today for a family swim with my husband and 3-year-old daughter. When booking over the phone, I was advised there would be free floats available and that she could choose between the large or small pool on the day. On arrival, we were informed the small pool was closed for lessons â€” which is understandable â€” but we were later told by a lifeguard that a float could be used, only for a swimming instructor to then refuse it and insist she swim without one.

Itâ€™s disappointing that safety seems to take a back seat to profit and scheduling. For young children, especially beginners, access to floats is a basic safety measure â€” not an optional luxury.

The main pool was also very cold, and even once the small pool reopened, there was no noticeable improvement in temperature. The toilets were unclean, though the showers were hot and the changing rooms reasonably spacious compared to Chester-le-Streetâ€™s.

We had planned to enrol our daughter in swimming lessons here, but after todayâ€™s experience, weâ€™re no longer confident this is a child-friendly or safety-conscious environment.
showerReviews.author: RK A

locations.title: David Lloyd Sunderland
locations.address: îƒˆ3 Camberwell Way, Sunderland SR3 3XN, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have never felt so comfortable using a gym. I was unhealthy when I joined, but I have never felt out of place at David Lloyd. The great support from the personal training sessions they offered when I joined has been invaluable.
Since joining, I have grown the confidence to then start using the clubs, favouring Spin but after trying Blaze, this has become a favourite as well.
My daughter's love going swimming and has developed loads, building a great relationship with Joss, who is very approachable and great with the kids.
My eldest daughter is now able to do the classes they offer from 8 years old, another Blaze fan. Graham is absolutely brilliant with the kids, making sure they are safe, moving but mostly having loads of fun. Definitely recommend doing a family session if you have kids.
Overall, my health has improved drastically since joining David Lloyd, but mostly all of the family love it as well.
showerReviews.author: Julie Slack

showerReviews.reviewText:
After 5 weeks we do not want to go back. My wife feels very uncomfortable there and I have also seen why. Family changing rooms being used by single men. Family swimming time filled with solo males staring and intimidating single females with children. Booked courts being taken by the same people without care.
I reported a serious incident after I saw a women being leered at for a silly amount of time in the pool. The manager just gave me a free guest pass for the month. They dont care.
'Security is our number 1 priority' is the biggest lie in their contract. Avoid at all cost. I begged to be released from the contract and they just ignored me. We have spent 700 pound for 5 weeks gym and they still want more even after their admitted failings.
showerReviews.author: HyperAuto Gaming

showerReviews.reviewText:
I visited David Lloyd recently using a guest pass, and honestly, thank God I did. I was considering joining, but after my visit, I definitely wonâ€™t be.

The gym itself is okay, standard equipment, nothing special or particularly premium to justify the high price tag. The spa facilities were the biggest disappointment. While I was in the jacuzzi with my partner, I took my phone out to snap a quick photo of us, and the lifeguard immediately told me I couldnâ€™t use my phone in the water due to â€œhealth and safety.â€ I understand if there are privacy or safety rules, but this was explained really poorly and came across as over the top. There was no clear signage anywhere about this rule, so it felt unnecessarily strict and awkward.

The womenâ€™s changing rooms were also in poor condition. The towel bins were completely overflowing, towels were hanging out from all sides, and people had started putting them on the floor because there was nowhere else to put them. For a club that charges over Â£100 a month, I expected much better maintenance and cleanliness.

Overall, the experience just didnâ€™t live up to the â€œluxuryâ€ image David Lloyd sells. Iâ€™m really glad I only went as a guest because itâ€™s definitely not worth paying full membership for.
showerReviews.author: laiba

showerReviews.reviewText:
I very often notice that people cut their nails and scrape off skin in the sauna, creating a mess and a lot of filth. I feel absolutely disgusted in such situations. This issue was reported to the management of the leisure centre, but no action was taken.
It seems that the visitors care more about hygiene than the administration does.
And since the pool is regularly visited by many children, it would be appropriate to escalate this to higher authorities in order to prompt the administration to take an interest.

showerReviews.reviewText:
The university gym: I'd expect more to be honest.

So I'm an athlete at the University and I train regularly at the gym. It is a nice enough gym with an okay range of equipment and a small flexibility area. Flexibility is key to me and my sport so I use the area regularly.

In the last year I've had a few issues with inappropriate behaviour and misuse of the flexibility area (usually by men). The staff are 50/50 between absolutely on it and basically being the problem.
This includes using the area as a coat rack or place to take calls.
Stepping over me mid yoga position.
Staff told me to "come at another time" or "try to use the room downstairs, but it has no booking system so it's 50/50 if its free"

(Other staff were incredible and have offered to stand in the gym to keep an eye on the issue. Fingers crossed this attitude continues and the new lockers help reduce the misuse)

Things seem to improve in the late spring term, but I will be keeping an eye out come September as everyone has the right to work out in peace.

Membership is a good price and comes with added bonuses like access to the hall, Badminton,  volleyball and climbing. Equipment range is usable and you're never usually waiting too long for equipment. Would be nice to have a full length mirror in the changing rooms for progression pictures as the mirrors in the main gym are in awkward places if you don't want everyone in the photo (GDPR/ Privacy). Changing rooms are a good size,  there is water fountains, vending machines, university merchandise (gym clothing)  and a lift which is great for accessibility.

Their communication with Team Sunderland is lacking, but that could be either side at fault and I hope to help improve this come September as the Social Secretary for a club and supporting Secretary for another.

Looking forward to the new Â£1 lockers as the 20p ones could be temperamental and I always have a Â£1 on me ðŸ˜‚

All in all you can't complain for the price, but at the same time if they are going to be on uni campus they need to step up and act like they are part of the university with safeguarding and attitudes. It's 2022.
showerReviews.author: Jade Moore

showerReviews.reviewText:
I attend some fitness classes at the university gym. The prices very reasonable (Â£25 for external customers/cancel 'anytime').

There is a good selection of classes, including some LesMills pump and grit, some very good instructors and some helpful front desk staff.

The fitness studio has got some ventilation system but no proper air-conditioning so higher intensity classes are not really enjoyable there (too hot).

The studio has some new equipment including new benches and new barbells for the pump classes as well as new mats and a new mat hanger so better organised now. Some  more rubber coated dumbbells would maka a nice addition to what is already there. Especially 3kg ones.

The studio (which they call a multi-purpose room) is of a good size but a large lifting station was added to it-blocks off a large chunk of space. Only approx 10 people can comfortably fit in there for a pump class (although the booking system allows more). This is not a lot for a university with a large number of students. The lifting station could go upstairs to the main gym area-instead of the technogym bikes which are pretty much useless there<- do not hold resistance in a standing up position).

Downsides; the studio is almost always dirty and the cleaners usually claim it was 'cleaned yesterday' when it clearly wasn't.The floor is still unattractive /too bright/shiny+ dirty most of the time with hair, bits of snacks , hair and dried sweat droplets.. . University cleaners only use water to wash it (once in a blue moon). Ideal fitness studio floor would be wooden, non-slippery, not very glossy and washed daily. The mirror at the front of the studio is often filthy with palm prints/smears all over- very unpleasant.

The classes usually only have a handful of people in them /mostly 40+) I wonder where do all the students go:? Probably looking for another foreigner-friendly club in the area (which from my experience/observations does not exist). Another main reasons students do not come to classes during the day; poor quality drying station/design of the changing room (difficult to quickly take shower and get dried/changed  before a next class.

The best improvement made; some new nice new colourful lights however not strong enough and remain switched off in most classes.

The music in some classes is too quiet. Music is a main component of a fitness class and should be positive and  loud enough for us not to hear our joints cracking.

Main things that can be improved here/ worth investing in;
Installing proper air-conditioning which instructors can control/set the right temperature for each class according to the intensity and the number of people attending. Especially in pump/spin/grit classes. Improving the design of the changing room so more students/staff can pop in for a class during the day.

Next thing that would be helpful; instructors' names displayed with the timetable so members can choose classes with the instructors they like. Some instructors deliver uninteresting, low energy classes with too loud /or too quiet music and customers usually avoid them. One of the instructors cannot be bothered to show the movements to customers (not fair on other staff who work hard to deliver good classes for the same pay).

From my observations reception work does not mix well with a fitness instructor's work. The staf who sit in a front desk often deliver lower quality/low energy classes...ask JD what they do with fitness instructors who cannot attract 6 people to a class. Their system may be 'brutal' but creates better outcome for customers/ results in better attendance.

"Little John' delivers best strength class so others could learn form him.

Not sure if the facility still  has a manager because he does not respond to emails from members<- which can make members feel unwelcome.
showerReviews.author: Lady Sunderland

locations.title: Nissan Sports & Leisure Complex
locations.address: îƒˆWashington Rd, Sunderland SR5 3HZ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I really had high hopes when my wife mentioned about going to a Christmas event here. Only to be let down in multiple ways.
Firstly, what should have been a 20 minute drive, took 70 minutes because Google maps kept trying to take you to the wrong place in the vast area that is the Nissan complex. The security that we spoke to gave us the worse directions, "go back the way you came, go to the traffic lights, and then keep turning right 4 times" (genuinely what he said) only for that to take us back to the same set of traffic lights.
There are barely any signs to direct you here and I hope you enjoy going around really large parking lots, because you'll be doing this alot and getting lost in them as well.
When we finally got to the complex, once again let down. When you hear that it is accessible, you'd think you can easily use a wheelchair or a push chair... nope, hope you like climbing steep stairs.
The stands and "music" that were playing were disappointing to say the least and not giving off a Christmas vibe at all unless you count the choir they had which sounded like elderly relatives that were drunk off their faces having a sing song.
Cut to where we are going to leave but my daughter needed her nappy changed. Toilets are poorly sign posted but relatively easy to find on the lower floor (no toilets upstairs so gotta use the stairs again).
At this point it needs to be mentioned that the hygiene record check logs (what needs to be signed AFTER the toilets have been INSPECTED and CLEANED). I'm waiting outside in the hall way while my wife is in the toilet with my daughter and a member of staff walks up to each of the toilet hygiene records, signs her name with a time and DOES NOT EVEN GLANCE INTO THE TOILETS TO SEE IF THEY ARE CLEAN AND WALKS OFF.
I wish I could give zero stars, because 1 star does not give this place justice as to how awful it is. If you can avoid going to this place, then do it.
showerReviews.author: Mark Anthony Bennett

locations.title: PureGym Sunderland
locations.address: îƒˆSunderland Retail Park, Newcastle Rd, Roker, Sunderland SR6 0BT, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
It's cheap and cheerful with friendly staff and decent enough basic equipment for anyone who isn't training on a competitive level.

Tends to get really busy at times meaning some machines are monopolised but it's rarely crowded thanks to a large floorspace.

The changing rooms have recently undergone a nice improvement. However, the lockers in there are too small to fit a motorcycle helmet in. This means I sometimes have to get changed then exit the changing rooms to store things in the larger lockers outside, a minor inconvenience.

Something I've noticed about all PureGyms is that when equipment breaks down it can take quite a long time for them to fix or replace it. Sometimes for many weeks, which can interfere with a varied workout routine.

The classes have music that is way too loud, you can hear it over personal headphones. I'd only do one of those classes if you're interested in some tinnitus with your workout.

I know I said cheap earlier but it seems they're always trying to bump up the prices slowly. Recently got an email saying they're going up by Â£2 a month in December which is %10 on top of what I'm paying now. At some point it's going to become only slightly more expensive to sign up to a much better quality gym with more facilities.

I visit Sunderland, Longbenton and Gateshead PureGyms. They all have their strengths and weaknesses but ultimately they're mostly a 'no frills' franchise gym that is decent enough if you don't have professional athletic or bodybuilding goals.

For me, Sunderland stands out because it has two large leg presses but it's not better or worse than the others.

Bumping this up a star since staff were really good with dealing with my motorcycle almost getting stolen. Even had a guy sit outside near bikes in his coffee break to keep an eye on them ðŸ‘ðŸ»

Update Oct 24: Had to lower my score again as multiple machines have been broken for long periods of time. The incline press machine in particular is one of my faves and has been broken since June... it's now Oct

Update Jul 25: They've finally managed to replace some of the aging machines with nice new ones. However they've removed some machines entirely and not replaced them, Back Extension and Lateral Raise machines are 2 off the top of my head. Would've bumped up a star but they took as much as they gave
showerReviews.author: Marc Macabre

I visit Sunderland, Longbenton and Gateshead PureGyms. They all have their strengths and weaknesses but ultimately they're mostly a 'no frills' franchise gym that is decent enough if you don't have professional athletic or bodybuilding goals.

For me, Sunderland stands out because it has two large leg presses but it's not better or worse than the others.

Bumping this up a star since staff were really good with dealing with my motorcycle almost getting stolen. Even had a guy sit outside near bikes in his coffee break to keep an eye on them ðŸ‘ðŸ»

Update Oct 24: Had to lower my score again as multiple machines have been broken for long periods of time. The incline press machine in particular is one of my faves and has been broken since June... it's now Oct

Update Jul 25: They've finally managed to replace some of the aging machines with nice new ones. However they've removed some machines entirely and not replaced them, Back Extension and Lateral Raise machines are 2 off the top of my head. Would've bumped up a star but they took as much as they gave

I wish the machines were a little cleaner. Sometimes you can tell it hasnâ€™t been wiped down for weeks. I donâ€™t mind having paper towel and disinfectant spray for us to wipe down before and after using the equipment like we did during Covid. The abductor machine hasnâ€™t been working very well for weeks and makes the loudest screechiest noise, I reported this to the staff however nothing has been done. showerReviews.reviewText:
Used to be a fantastic gym.  Recently rejoined and the place is now dropping to bits and filthy.
Showers are full of black mould and broken floor tiles.  Pool had used plasters round the edge, gym floor was a mess and the equipment old and on it's last legs.  Steam room has mould issues too, massive health risk.
Did not see any cleaning taking place.  All three members of staff I passed on the way out were sat on their phones.

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great potential, but falls short in many areas.

Cleanliness is always absolutely sparkling - always someone on the gym floor cleaning no matter what time you go in. Offerings of machines, weights, etc is broad and covers everything you could need... (if they worked. I'll come back to that.) All but one of the staff on the desk are lovely and welcoming. However, that's where the positives stop.

Maintenance is close to non existent. in 3 months I've seen machines that have been broken for weeks if not months at a time. One cycle machine was only just fixed, having been broken day 1 of me attending the gym. Treadmills are dropping off like flies and don't seem to be even considering a fix (2 of them are quickly approaching 2 months I believe). Cable weights all worn and some snapped, again taking weeks to fix. Jacuzzi and sauna recently out of order for a good month.

Gaping hole in the ceiling of the mens changing room when I came last week, dripping lightly, a week later now dripping heavily and splashing all over the floor (Despite the bucket catching the water being almost full to the brim). Absolutely no urgency to fix things at all, even if its going to cost them more leaving it. Like in this case. Mens toilets in the changing rooms are also out of order and have been for a good 6 weeks. The upstairs disabled facilities have been remarked as Male Toilets - Which is an awful band-aid.

Gigantic hole in the plaster of the stairs walls covered over by a banner for 2-3 weeks now.. rather than, you know, getting someone in to fix it. No, the sign didn't stop people noticing.

A much nicer gym than my previous one in terms of, at least potential, offerings.. but management and maintenance doesn't even begin to compare.  As another review mentioned, membership comes out on time at full price every month despite these major shortcomings, which is frankly unacceptable. Guess thats what the 12 month contract trap is for.
showerReviews.author: Jake

showerReviews.reviewText: The only lido/outdoor pool in Wales! Park nearby at Gas Road car park (Â£1 for 2 hours) as no parking at the pool itself. Great value at only Â£3 per adult for a 1 hour session. Changing and lockers (Â£1 refundable) available either poolside (traditional cubicles) or indoor (modern, clean). Hot showers (poolside or indoor). There are 3 pools onsite (25m lanes, smaller leisure, and beach-style), all heated to 28Â°. Pool and facilities are clean. We went during term time, so public sessions are limited and very popular. Bit of a holiday vibe, with classic pop blaring throughout the session and  'hi-de-hi' tannoy announcements. Cafe and exhibition not open when we visited, which was slightly disappointing. Nevertheless, well worth a visit.

locations.title: Woburn Lido
locations.address: îƒˆCrawley Rd, Woburn, Milton Keynes MK17 9QG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
A Perfect Day at Woburn Lido

From the moment I arrived at Woburn Lido, I knew I was in for a treat. Nestled in the charming village of Woburn, this historic outdoor pool is a hidden gem that offers a delightful escape from the hustle and bustle of everyday life.

The first thing that struck me was the stunning Art Deco architecture. The beautifully restored changing rooms, with their vibrant tiles and classic arches, transported me back to the 1930s. It was like stepping into a different era, and I couldnâ€™t help but admire the attention to detail that has gone into preserving this piece of history.

As I dipped my toes into the crystal-clear water, I was pleasantly surprised by the perfect temperature. The pool is heated to a comfortable 26Â°C, making it ideal for a leisurely swim or a more vigorous workout. The separate paddling pool for children is a thoughtful touch, ensuring that families can enjoy their time here without any worries.

The atmosphere at Woburn Lido is incredibly relaxing. Surrounded by lush greenery, the pool area feels like a tranquil oasis. I spent hours lounging by the pool, soaking up the sun, and taking refreshing dips whenever I felt like it. The friendly staff were always on hand, making sure everything was just right.

One of the highlights of my visit was the sense of community. Locals and visitors alike come together here, creating a warm and welcoming environment. I had some lovely conversations with fellow swimmers, sharing stories and tips about the best spots in the area.

After a day of swimming and relaxation, I treated myself to a delicious snack from the on-site kiosk. The selection of refreshments was impressive, and I enjoyed a tasty ice cream while basking in the late afternoon sun.

As the day came to an end, I couldnâ€™t help but feel grateful for this wonderful experience. Woburn Lido is more than just a swimming pool; itâ€™s a place where memories are made. Whether youâ€™re looking for a peaceful retreat or a fun day out with family and friends, Woburn Lido is the perfect destination.
showerReviews.author: tony wheatley

One of the highlights of my visit was the sense of community. Locals and visitors alike come together here, creating a warm and welcoming environment. I had some lovely conversations with fellow swimmers, sharing stories and tips about the best spots in the area.

After a day of swimming and relaxation, I treated myself to a delicious snack from the on-site kiosk. The selection of refreshments was impressive, and I enjoyed a tasty ice cream while basking in the late afternoon sun.

As the day came to an end, I couldnâ€™t help but feel grateful for this wonderful experience. Woburn Lido is more than just a swimming pool; itâ€™s a place where memories are made. Whether youâ€™re looking for a peaceful retreat or a fun day out with family and friends, Woburn Lido is the perfect destination.
showerReviews.author: tony wheatley

The pool is clean and well maintained, as are the changing rooms, there's seating round the pool but space is limited so don't expect sun loungers - although there is a grass area at the end of the pool where you could stretch out on a towel. There's also a cafe on site for hot and cold drinks, snacks and ice creams.
Lovely pool, lovely staff, will be back regularly â˜ºï¸â˜ºï¸

Wonderful pool with a lovely community feel. Booking is easy, and in cold water season can usually book the day before without issue. In the summer I find itâ€™s better to book a week in advance. Right now itâ€™s limited to 10 swimmers at a time, which tbh is about the max number Iâ€™d want for lane swimming anyway. Thereâ€™s a slow lane and a fast lane, and there are not usually any issues with people being in the wrong place.

The changing rooms are clean though small. The cafe is good for a quick hot drink to warm up afterwards & is reasonably priced. Lifeguards are welcoming and encouraging. The car park is tiny, but there are hundreds of spaces across the road, which is clearly signposted. Everyone Iâ€™ve encountered has been very friendly and at the right time you can spot elephants over at Woburn Safari Park!

locations.title: Sea Lanes Brighton
locations.address: îƒˆ300 Madeira Dr, Brighton BN2 1BX, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very disappointing experience due to misleading advertising and poor communication.

The swimming pool water is quite cold, and memberships come with a mandatory minimum term. On top of that, cancellations require at least 30 daysâ€™ notice, which is not clearly disclosed upfront.

I saw an Instagram ad offering the current month for free. I messaged them to ask if there were any conditions, and I was told the only significant one was a minimum term of one month. No mention was made of the 30-day notice period.

I went to the facilities to try them out, but they were closing and asked me to return the next day. I specifically asked if I could swim for free that month as advertised, and they confirmed this again, with no additional conditions mentioned. I couldnâ€™t go the following day, but they later called me and we agreed I would come back, still with no further information disclosed.

I am traveling in 10 days and simply wanted to try the pool once, with the intention of signing up properly when I return to Brighton. I prepared everything in advance, including bringing my wetsuit and assembling new fins.

When I finally arrived, I was told that I would still have to pay for the following month even if I didnâ€™t use the facility, because cancellations require 30 daysâ€™ notice. As a result, I couldnâ€™t swim at all.

This was extremely frustrating. The advertisement was misleading, and despite communicating with them multiple times across different channels, this crucial condition was never mentioned. A â€œfree monthâ€ offer that still obliges you to pay for an additional month is not truly free.

The views are nice when the weather is good, thatâ€™s the only positive aspect of my experience.
showerReviews.author: Mat Mora

showerReviews.reviewText:
More than a swimming pool on the beach, which it definitely IS, but one that has a whole lot of other things in the same place as well.  More reminiscent of a pop-up box park, this little beachfront leisure complex of assorted components is no doubt marketed as a complete destination venue package for the discerningly trendy.
Beer? Yep. Coffee? Yep. Pizza? Yep. Take your pick, swimming isn't a requirement for use or entry or even access. Leisurely lounging about these interlocking wooden sustainable hipster sheds that will sell you stuff to fill your stomach and maybe your happiness meter. No guarantees  on your soul but I imagine that's a job for the sunset on a summer evening, sharing the chilled vibes with the company of your choice. (meaning person or people obv...)
showerReviews.author: Matthew Max Jackson

showerReviews.reviewText:
Iâ€™ve visited twice - Iâ€™m a couple of hours away otherwise Iâ€™d be here all the time. Beautiful pool with lovely views, 19 degrees on both occasions Iâ€™ve visited which is warmer than Iâ€™m used to. Very clean surrounds and changing areas and staff are welcoming but unobtrusive.

A few tips:

Bring your own padlock and key for the lockers, or there are small wire cages outside in sight of the pool for small items.

The changing areas are unisex with lockable individual cubicles. Very clean. Shoes should be removed at the door.

All pool users must wear swim caps.

I booked on the first occasion but not the second - was welcomed both times and there was plenty of room to swim.

The pool is divided into several lanes (slow/medium/fast) according to swim speed.

There are warm showers in the changing rooms and both warm and cold showers poolside.

I asked the lifeguard if it was ok to take photographs. It is. As always I blur photos of other pool users outside my own family.

There is a cafe next to the pool but unfortunately I didnâ€™t have the time to try it.
showerReviews.author: Susan Herts

showerReviews.reviewText:
Update July 2025:

Great visit today to this beautiful wetlands site in Washington. It is a great, peaceful day out with walks, picnics and outdoor play. There is lots to do for all family ... We had a picnic today but had been to cafe before and it is nice. There is a playground for kids, an allotment, many birtld spotting places, a cabin near some Wetlands and the oldest oak in Washington, just to name few. It only takes 3 visits a year here to pay off for the family annual pass so we think it is well worth it. Truly wonderful place to be with nature.

________________
Great nature walks, ducks feeding, lovely picnic spots. Fab day family day out.

The gym its self is amazing, clean, spacious, modern and has every bit of equipment you could ever need, from free weights, to weight machines, cardio, boxing ring and bags, fitness classes, also its equipped with toliets and shower and a supplement shop. showerReviews.reviewText:
To not waste time: I have only great things to say about this gym or the Personal Trainers who work there.

I had always been weary of trying a PT â€“ thinking it would be far too intense or daunting â€“ but I'm so happy to say I was wrong. James Andrew Hales made me feel right at home from the very day I signed up. That was four months ago now, and ever since I have been going consistently multiple times a week. My cardio has dramatically improved, I'm lifting up to triple from where I started from and still building, and James has truly instilled genuine joy into working out for me.

The gym itself is a very easy recommendation: A full spectrum of machines & free weights, an incredibly cool lowered area for circuit & heavy bag training, and a super clean locker & shower area. Every single area of the gym is utilised perfectly â€“ the owner has done a fantastic job of building a welcoming, friendly, and highly functional space. Not to mention 24/7 access! Top marks all around.

locations.title: Energie Fitness Scunthorpe
locations.address: îƒˆEnergie Fitness, Mannaberg Way, Scunthorpe DN15 8XF, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great gym, can't be beaten when it comes to cardio as there's alot of different machines. Showers aren't good as they're small, you hang a towel on the inside door and it'll get soaked so I have to throw it well over the door, also the lockers are rusty inside and some of them are hard to turn the handle to close, you'll need to bring your own padlock and make sure it's thin enough to fit.
There's a upstairs open plan too and that's for legs, good selection and also classes you can book on the app which is a brilliant idea. Not been to one yet but planning on doing.
Good staff, free water ( been to other gyms that have no water and charge for small bottles)
Brilliant opening/closing times especially for shift workers.
Big car park free parking.
Even a jukebox for the public which is definitely different.
The weights are okay plenty to go at but I find some other gyms are more upper weight happy with more machines.
Big, open plan sort of gym and a fingerprint scanner to get in. (Has a face scanner now)
Would be great if it was 24/7 but the times are good enough really.
6am/11pm mon/Thurs
6am/10pm Fri
7am/8pm Sat/Sun
As it stands at this time.
Id check online times to be sure.

Money wise it's okay.
You can go into 6 months contract for around Â£22 a month roughly.
Or Â£35 a month roughly for no contact.
Different tiers of membership perks like the "WOW Membership" gives you access to classes and free coffee and bring a friend with you two or three times a week if they have no membership.
You also get discounts on the app for under armour gear and others.
Hope this helps.

UPDATE
Lockers have been sorted so I've changed my rating to 5 starts from 4.
Brilliant staff and great equipment.

UPDATE 2025
No More juke box, think its broken.
Now the gym have a big speaker on playing alot of Dance music so if tgats not your thing like myself,  bring your earphones.
Cause heavy metal is my Jam.
New machines which is always great!
Still my favourite gym for the last 3 years, although like alot of gyms nowadays its really busy so going outside peak times is best. Still wished it was 24/7 like Reso 24 but its open till 11pm through the week so not bad.
Staff are brilliant ðŸ‘ðŸ» always have been.
Steve is a legend and happy to help.
showerReviews.author: Danny Niland

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great gym, can't be beaten when it comes to cardio as there's alot of different machines. Showers aren't good as they're small, you hang a towel on the inside door and it'll get soaked so I have to throw it well over the door, also the lockers are rusty inside and some of them are hard to turn the handle to close, you'll need to bring your own padlock and make sure it's thin enough to fit.
There's a upstairs open plan too and that's for legs, good selection and also classes you can book on the app which is a brilliant idea. Not been to one yet but planning on doing.
Good staff, free water ( been to other gyms that have no water and charge for small bottles)
Brilliant opening/closing times especially for shift workers.
Big car park free parking.
Even a jukebox for the public which is definitely different.
The weights are okay plenty to go at but I find some other gyms are more upper weight happy with more machines.
Big, open plan sort of gym and a fingerprint scanner to get in. (Has a face scanner now)
Would be great if it was 24/7 but the times are good enough really.
6am/11pm mon/Thurs
6am/10pm Fri
7am/8pm Sat/Sun
As it stands at this time.
Id check online times to be sure.

Money wise it's okay.
You can go into 6 months contract for around Â£22 a month roughly.
Or Â£35 a month roughly for no contact.
Different tiers of membership perks like the "WOW Membership" gives you access to classes and free coffee and bring a friend with you two or three times a week if they have no membership.
You also get discounts on the app for under armour gear and others.
Hope this helps.

UPDATE
Lockers have been sorted so I've changed my rating to 5 starts from 4.
Brilliant staff and great equipment.

UPDATE 2025
No More juke box, think its broken.
Now the gym have a big speaker on playing alot of Dance music so if tgats not your thing like myself,  bring your earphones.
Cause heavy metal is my Jam.
New machines which is always great!
Still my favourite gym for the last 3 years, although like alot of gyms nowadays its really busy so going outside peak times is best. Still wished it was 24/7 like Reso 24 but its open till 11pm through the week so not bad.
Staff are brilliant ðŸ‘ðŸ» always have been.
Steve is a legend and happy to help.

Terrible experience, the instructor Olivia spent the first 15 minutes of the lesson telling me off poolside for being 15 minutes early, having my shoes on (no signs anywhere plus workmen walking around with riggerboots on), and scoffing at the only previous lessons my son had was through school lessons.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I cannot recommend Olivia from Swim Now enough!! She is amazing at what she does and has a wonderful teaching style.

My daughter had went to group lessons from age 4 until age 8 where she was stuck on stage 4 for years. Not because she feared the water, she has always been a water baby but the group lessons she went to had taken too many children and divided the pool into lots of sub groups they bearly had 5 meters in each group to learn in.

We started lessons with Olivia in April 2024 and between then and now Oliver has shown my daughter the correct technics for each stroke, and she has built her core strength and stamina.

Most importantly Olivia has brought back the joy of swimming for my daughter and in July 2024, just 3.5mths after starting she has went from stage 4 to stage 7!! Achieving this with just one lesson a week !!

By far the best swimming teacher around and my daughter loves going.

Olivia has a wonderful rapport with her where they have lots of fun but she is always learning and being pushed to be her best.

Highly recommend
showerReviews.author: Donna Buchanan

showerReviews.reviewText:
As a driver for a container firm, This truckstop is ideally located for Teesport and the surrounding area. The yard is slightly rough and can be a bit muddy when its very wet, Or dusty when dry.

It's a fenced, Secure compound with a manned gate 24/7 with polite and helpful security.

Parking costs Â£20 per 24hr period but be aware they accept cash only for parking and the restaurant.

For your Â£20 you get parking, A shower and a meal with a tea or coffee.

Its good quality, home cooked food with a range of mains and puddings. The helpings are a very reasonable size.

Toilets and showers are clean, You change in 1 cubicle and shower in another. Keeps the showers cleaner.

All in all, Â£20 for secure parking, Evening meal and a shower isn't to be sniffed at.

100% recommended ðŸ˜ŽðŸ’ªðŸ‘

Will be coming again  thanks

Excellent Breakfast at Stokyard

I had a wonderful experience at this restaurant, where I enjoyed one of the best breakfasts â€“ the "Stokyard Breakfast." Everything was perfectly cooked and very tasty. I opted for toast and requested no black pudding or milk in my tea, and the staff followed my preferences exactly.

The restaurant also has a bar, but customers should be mindful of the hours, as it is not open all day. I've attached some photos of the restaurant and bar schedule to help plan your visit. The hours are a bit limited, so make sure to check before coming.

For truck drivers, thereâ€™s also a Â£5 voucher available, which is a nice bonus.

I was also very impressed with the facilities. The showers were hot and extremely clean, as were the toilets.

I highly recommend this place for anyone looking for a delicious breakfast and clean facilities, especially if you're just passing through!

locations.title: The Salvation Army Swan Lodge Lifehouse
locations.address: îƒˆHostel, High St E, Sunderland SR1 2AU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: This is a refuge for the vulnerable, a place of safety for all who dwell here. It is a big surprise of a place. You reading this could find yourself homeless, fortunes change, jobs can be lost. Private Landlords are quick to realise their assets for all sorts of reasons. Death in a family & offspring or siblings need to gain access to the value of a rental property. Anybody can become homeless the young can have irreconcilable family difficulties, people fall out with their life partners and temporary homelessness can and does happen. People can find their their way to this rather wonderful facility. For an endless number of reasons. To enter here is to find a place where people live together with difference. It is welcoming sensitive and capable. Swan Lodge staff are caring responsible and delicate to those who enter for the myriad of reasons that bring people to the door. It warms people through, provides hot water to bath or shower and feeds them. It is not a male only facility their are women in this building too. If you are wondering what is that place? and what does it do? Spend some time looking it up. The Salvation Army is a Christian Charity without the help of  generous Caring members of the public it would not be possible to provide places like Swan Lodge. Swan Lodge is a rescue centre reaching out to those who find themselves in tragic, and difficult circumstances. This is a home. A great place to call home. A welcoming place, and a safe controlled space from which people can rebuild their lives. And they do.
showerReviews.author: Rob.D.M

showerReviews.reviewText:
I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding the unacceptable living conditions, unreasonable treatment, and lack of tenant protections at Jopling House. The conduct of management and superintendents has created an environment that is not only unprofessional but also unsafe and unfair to tenants.

1. Unreasonable Conduct by Superintendents

Superintendents at Jopling House regularly impose fines without legitimate reasons or explanations. Tenants are left confused, with no clear policy, written notice, or justification. This practice is unfair, arbitrary, and appears to be used as a method of intimidation and revenue generation rather than genuine enforcement of building rules.

In addition, staff have demonstrated disrespectful behavior toward tenants, treating legitimate questions and concerns with hostility rather than professionalism.

2. Barging into Tenant Units Without Consent

One of the most serious issues is that superintendents and/or staff have entered tenant units without notice or consentâ€”even during times when tenants were in the shower. This is a gross violation of tenant privacy and safety. Entering a unit without proper legal notice or emergency justification constitutes harassment and a breach of tenant rights under housing law.

3. Non-Functional Laundry Facilities

The laundry facilities are often in disrepair, leaving tenants without access to basic services that are supposed to be included as part of their tenancy. Machines frequently break down, and management does not address or resolve the issues in a timely manner, forcing tenants to seek alternatives at their own expense.

4. Internet Issues and Mismanagement

The building previously provided a working Wi-Fi service but has since switched tenants to a subpar, unreliable network. Staff have openly admitted that this downgrade was done to save money, despite the significant negative impact on tenants who rely on stable internet for work, study, and daily communication. The current Wi-Fi service is slow, inconsistent, and in no way meets modern standards.

5. Horrible Customer Service

When tenants attempt to raise concerns, they are met with dismissive, rude, or evasive responses. Instead of providing solutions, management and staff avoid responsibility and treat tenants with contempt. This lack of accountability leaves tenants feeling powerless and unsupported.

6. Lack of Tenant Protections

Overall, Jopling House operates without regard for tenant protections. The combination of unjustified fines, unauthorized entry into units, poor amenities, and intentional cost-cutting at the expense of tenants demonstrates a clear pattern of neglect and abuse.

To sum it up, this is a disgraceful student accomodation and the staff lack any sense of decorum and manners, otherwise they would have addressed these issues in the last 2 years.
showerReviews.author: Steven Nakhla

(1) heat is not on whenever youâ€™d like and they donâ€™t allow us to have our own heaters, so youâ€™re mostly left to freeze. Youâ€™d think with the amount weâ€™re paying the least they could do is let us be warm. Park Lane is half the price and they let us control when we want heating (and they also allowed you to have your own heaters)

(2) will randomly do â€œrenovationsâ€ and kick you out of your own room unannounced. Youâ€™re also left with the mess they cause after. So not only are you getting kicked out for hours, but you have to come back to clean a big mess.

(3) walls are paper thin, so enjoy hearing everything the people next door to you are doing. Nothing is done about noise complaints either.

(4) if they set an appointment to see an issue or cleaning, they wonâ€™t come at that time, theyâ€™ll come at any other time convenient for them

(5) will charge you more for extra appliances. Again at Park Lane, paid half the price that I did at Jopling, with the same appliances and never got told to pay extra. I also wasnâ€™t even using the appliances and let them know beforehand, yet they still tried getting me to pay for them.

(6) no elevators to the top floor.

(7) wifi is terrible, and they recently changed servers which made it worse. Thankfully UK data plans are cheap.

(8) they really take advantage of the master key and go into anyoneâ€™s room whenever they want. It could be 8am still in bed or youâ€™re in the shower and theyâ€™ll come barging in. No feeling of privacy.

(9) moved in while they were switching companies, so our payment was made to the old landlord. Legally, it shouldâ€™ve been their responsibility to retrieve that payment back or reimburse us, instead they took no action and made us pay again. We lost Â£6000+. This is a major issue, but a good example of how this company will cheat you out of money in any way they can, even with more minor things.

Only good thing I guess is the location to the mall, inbetween the two campuses, and the metro. Nothing else is particularly good. Even the quality of the rooms is subpar. If I wasnâ€™t under contract I probably wouldâ€™ve left the first week. Apparently the old management was better, which is why many old tenants were recommending this place. I wouldâ€™ve stayed at Park Lane had I not had to share a space with 5 other people â€” if you donâ€™t mind flatmates, itâ€™s a good option. If you do, then again, AXO is great with better rooms & social areas, and also in the same convenient location.
showerReviews.author: Pop Culture Verdict

locations.title: West Hall Scout Campsite
locations.address: îƒˆMoor Ln, Whitburn, Sunderland SR6 7JT, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: We love this place and have been here many times. We visit this place as a group, as I help to run a support group. It's like being in the middle of the country. The area is lined with trees and has fields either side. The lodge is well equipped with a large 6 ring cooker & double oven with a separate electric cooker. There is a large larder fridge and freezer, dish washer, microwave, toaster and hot water boiler for instant hot water. The living area has a wood stove and the camp owners have mountains of wood to burn. There is both large and small fire pits, again, more than ample supply of wood to use. The field is large and we are able to have games if football, treasure hunts, rounders, water games etc. There is a small parking area at the entrance and enough space for around 6 cars outside of the lodge too. There is a marquee and a patio area and this is great for BBQ and outside activities if the weather lets us down as it offers a little bit of protection from wind. There are 9 bedrooms with bunk beds, sleeping up to 36 (8 X 4 and 1 X 2 rooms) and 2 rooms are slightly larger so can fit a blow up bed on the floor if needed. Camping is also an option. There is plenty of space, we regularly have 40+ people here, and are able to cater for them easily too. The shower facilities are also ample with 4 shower rooms all with toilets and an extra cloakroom. The heaters in all rooms are very good. All in all, we always have a great time and is great for getting the kids out in the fresh air. We are returning here nearer Xmas for our Xmas party.
showerReviews.author: Samantha Martin

showerReviews.reviewText: A lovely site amid trees. There's a toilet and wash area, a kitchen area and a few bunkbeds. The site can be rented out for a wedding venue and there's plenty of wildlife around....if your quiet and keep eyes and ears open! It's not open to the public normally, except when they do bonfire night fireworks. A lovely setting for a wedding too. They have a big bonfire and fireworks nearly every year, but it can get very crowded, depending on the weather. Can't recommend it enough.

showerReviews.reviewText: The site is nice, the pitches well spaced and an excellent shower and ablutions block, everything you would expect and all the site is very clean. However it's run on rules rules rules! Don't turn up early you will have to wait, but your not allowed to wait outside the gate, there is no mention of arrival time and the fact you will be  denied entry if you arrive during the staff lunch break, the staff are very strict and not at all warm and welcoming, they site and facilities were not explained or pointed out nor the need for a barrier tab, they were more concerned about following the rules and seem to have forgotten guests are there business. It felt more like a council run business, where you must do as you are told. We had a friend travel two hours to collect some urgent equipment from us, and they were denied entry, ("we can't allow them on site" we were told) under protest they were allowed on for a few minutes. Unfortunately we will not return, we actually prefer a more family run business, or a family focused site were the guests are put first and at the centre of the parks business model, not employees who think it's they duty to inforce the company rule book come what may!
showerReviews.author: Nelly Noow

showerReviews.reviewText:
Just came back from a holiday from hell.  We have never been to such a run-down site but strangely there was over 40 permanent sited caravans and yet the site needs to be renovated.

The taps not in the shower rooms are the push sort but only last one second and are green with lime scale.  The taps in the shower rooms are the twist sort but are also green with lime scale and some are loose. Everything is rusting.  The sinks, shelves, shower traps and almost everything else is rusting. The extractor fans in the shower rooms didnâ€™t work and as for the hand-dryer donâ€™t bother.  Its rubbish.  They only seemed to but be cleaned on the weekend and then only bleach down the toilets.  There is only soap in the main area and not in the showers rooms which also contains the toilets.

The shop was never open but they only sold chocolate and cans of pop anyway.  The childrenâ€™s play area is rusting to pieces and is falling apart. The track down to the park and around the park are full massive potholes.  Itâ€™s easier to drive on the grass. The washing up area only had two sinks which neither had plugs.  The grey disposal in that area smelt and had no pipe to rinse your waste container.

I think there was a shooting range next to the site, there were constant bangs, so no good for dogs.

The website needs updating because now the electric on site is via a card meter.  There was never anyone on site at reception and so were given a mobile numbers to call if you needed help but it just rang and rang. We didnâ€™t feel safe on site because according to one of the permanent sited caravan owners said that some gypsyâ€™s were living on-site.  In fact one day a drunk man walked up to our car and had a good look inside and then wanted to see our caravan.  We left the next morning.

I would not recommend this site at all, avoid!
showerReviews.author: MintPolo Homer

locations.title: Finchale Abbey Touring Park
locations.address: îƒˆFinchale Abbey Touring Park, Durham DH1 5SH, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Beautiful site we originally booked for 2 nights but once there extended for 5 nights. Whole site and facilities are immaculate it is very peaceful and ideal for those with dogs we took 2 labradors who thoroughly enjoyed walking in the woods and swimming in the river followed by a doggy ice cream everyday on the walk back. Every member of staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful nothing was too much trouble.
The site got very busy one night and it was still silent and the facilities kept spotless. We enjoyed it so much we are booking up for a week in August. I would recommend studying the map first and choosing your pitch carefully, the one we had would have been extremely difficult to get out with a caravan in tow due to 3 motor home bays directly infront and a hilly area behind so reversing may have been tricky if fully booked. We are both coach drivers so very confident in manoeuvring around awkward spaces. A HGV driver next to us also said he noticed this immediately too. That is literally the only minor criticism everything was perfect and we can't wait to return.
Please try there fresh eggs and honey you won't get better anywhere!
Overall if you want a adults only peaceful break away in stunning surroundings with spotless facilities this is definitely the place to book!
showerReviews.author: Samantha Jarvis

showerReviews.reviewText:
Beautiful site we originally booked for 2 nights but once there extended for 5 nights. Whole site and facilities are immaculate it is very peaceful and ideal for those with dogs we took 2 labradors who thoroughly enjoyed walking in the woods and swimming in the river followed by a doggy ice cream everyday on the walk back. Every member of staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful nothing was too much trouble.
The site got very busy one night and it was still silent and the facilities kept spotless. We enjoyed it so much we are booking up for a week in August. I would recommend studying the map first and choosing your pitch carefully, the one we had would have been extremely difficult to get out with a caravan in tow due to 3 motor home bays directly infront and a hilly area behind so reversing may have been tricky if fully booked. We are both coach drivers so very confident in manoeuvring around awkward spaces. A HGV driver next to us also said he noticed this immediately too. That is literally the only minor criticism everything was perfect and we can't wait to return.
Please try there fresh eggs and honey you won't get better anywhere!
Overall if you want a adults only peaceful break away in stunning surroundings with spotless facilities this is definitely the place to book!
showerReviews.author: Samantha Jarvis

showerReviews.reviewText: Nice site.  Could do with updating. Some pitches have hard ground.  Uneven ground and on grass.  Entry by ANPR.  Shower facilities are limited if the site is busy.  Mainly set up for caravans as I did not see anywhere for a motorhome to dump grey water.  Grey water for portable empty was behind a building.  Make sure you have a long hookup cable as the power was some way from the pitch.  On the outskirts of Durham to the North.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Small campsite, but equipped with everything you need. Friendly welcome. There is a good shower (no push button) that provides a steady supply of hot water, the lights don't go out in between showers, and there is a trash can in the room. It's sad to have to mention this specifically, but unfortunately it's often not the case. As a woman, I am particularly grateful for these things!
Two minor points: there were only three or five of us at the campsite, so the facilities are sufficient, but if it gets busier, another shower might be needed.
Making the site easier to find from the road would be in their own interest. :-)
showerReviews.author: Martin W

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great place that is local to us.
This place looks fairly new but gets the one thing right that is most important when camping and that is space. The pitches are very generous in size and each one feels private. There is a large grass field which is well kept and very flat,, just like the pitches.
Facilities are basic but there is everything you need, and most importantly very clean. There is only one shower that was kept clean, and when you consider some sites might have 4 or 5 showers but that could be for 40 or more pitches so I don't see a problem with this as there are not many pitches on this site.
Check-in was easy and prices are reasonable.
There are plenty of takeaways locally that will deliver to the site and it's only a short drive to local shops, pubs and the beach.
We have been camping/caravan for over 30 years and been to some of the best campsites and some of the worst. This site will be added to one of our favourite sites that we will come back to for the fact that it is local, quiet, friendly, clean and not too big or commercialised.
We did hire the fire pit which was very good value.
This is what a campsite should be like.
showerReviews.author: North East Sunderland

showerReviews.reviewText:
It's a 2 out of 5 simply because of the facilities.   The facilities are shabby and there are not enough for the amount of pitches on the site.  Two showers and two toilet.   The water in the shower  operates on a push button and the shower to the left was awful, I needed my hand on the button  all the time. The shower on the right was slightly better but the water didn't run away in the shower tray which is disgusting.    There is barely any room to move in the shower and the place to put soap and shampoo etc is to small.  Showering  was not a pleasant experience.  As for the toilets  there was no toilet paper or soap left mid morning in either cubicle and the cleaner came in and didn't even bother to fill up the soap which is just gross and it was empty for 2 whole days.  Luckily I take my own paper and soap.

There are two dish washing sinks and these have very hot water but they arent always kept clean either.

The campsite is  sited right next to a really  busy road so depending on where you  pitch it could be noisy with the traffic. But also we  got the feeling that it was  a campsite people used  for work. It  cleared out really early from 7am  and then the same people came back later, so it was quite noisy when they left and came back.

On the plus side there is a cafe on site and a pop up bar with snacks every evening.  You can hire Fire pits for Â£7.50 a night and buy logs for Â£10 and there is  a lovely little dog walking area.

I read reviews about  the site being noisy with people partying and it wasn't at all whilst we were there. I also read about there not being any dog walking from the site, there is if you look at the ordnance survey maps.  If you turn right out of the site and walk a short way along the road there is a track to your right,   follow the lane past the houses and through the  alpaca field  and there are lots of footpaths from here  including the 100 and The way of Love.  Additionally there is  a 30 minute walk to the Farmers Arms which is a pleasant little pub which does food and allows dogs inside too. And if you turn right and then left up the lane there is a lovely walk which takes you up to Cassop and a nice little pub there called P &K. They do food and let dogs in and very welcoming too.

It's a shame as this site has real  potential and could be really lovely.  But it is just lacking in it's  facilities.  There looks to be somekind of unfinished facility block on site, if these were finished and opened on this site it could be a game changer. But until then we wouldn't recommend it to anyone to  be honest.

And this is a real & honest  review, I review all our campsites and I do it honestly, but we are all different and  have our likes and dislikes.  The facilities are what make or break a campsite for us. But if you like walking it's a great place
showerReviews.author: Suzanne
