showerReviews.reviewText: A small fantastic site overlooking the north sea and St Mary's Lighthouse.  Small pitches, no awnings allowed (unless you are at the van), but a really lovely quiet  site.  The facilities are really  good  and are kept very clean.  The  showers have lots of hooks, adjustable heat, lots of space  and the water is  very hot. There are 3 private basins and 4 clean toilets.   Very hot water for dishwashing.  There is a Laundry area  and chemical toilet disposal.  The pitches are spaced out nicely but most pitches  need levellers.  We were glad not to have been nearest the sea as this is close to the fence and the other side is the busy England Coast Path and it can be noisy and nosy. Nice location close to Whitley Bay so some lovely coastal walking and great beaches. Really enjoyed our time on this site.
showerReviews.author: Suzanne

locations.title: Serenity Spa & Novara Skin and Aesthetics
locations.address: îƒˆLord Byrons Walk, Seaham SR7 7AD, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Very disappointing spa experience. We booked the Twilight spa after recommendations from family and friends. However, we were very disappointed to find the spa in need of updates and the atmosphere unrelaxing. On arrival, we were told the dinner reservation had been changed as they were busy, when asking for an earlier time, staff were unaccommodating and repeated it was in the small print upon booking. The robes we were provided with had tears and stains on them. There was no spa music, and with the spa being busy, it felt as though we were in a leisure centre. Multiple showers had a lime scale, broken controls, and lights not working. There were drains with covers hanging off. There was no staff presence. Rubbish had been left around the pools and in the sauna / steam rooms. Guests were vaping in the outdoor pools. The restaurant was a good atmosphere and the meal was really nice. Although the service was slow when coming to pay the bill. On leaving the spa, staff did not ask how our experience was or even look up from the desk when speaking. We did not take many photos as don't  like to have phones in the spa. We would not recommend and will not be returning.
showerReviews.author: Rachel Carfoot

showerReviews.reviewText: We did have a lovely stay here. Staff were very pleasant and helpful, and our lodge was lovely, with everything we needed! A couple of points to make - we ran out of hot water after 2 showers, apparently due to the size of the water tank, and were told this would keep happening. Not very helpful when it's a lodge for 4 people! We also couldn't get the heating to change and it kept reverting back to the scheduled settings. The spa was lovely and we enjoyed the many different areas, very relaxing. However I did find my massage a bit disappointing, after asking for firmer pressure when the therapist checked in with me, but this didn't last long. I didn't feel that it was worth what I paid for it, especially after having similar treatments at other spas for much less.
showerReviews.author: Emily Davey

showerReviews.reviewText: Good sized pool and plenty of changing facilities.  Limited private shower cubicles but several open showers. Shower cubicles aren't clean and the pool itself seems a bit mouldy around the edges. Friendly staff.

showerReviews.reviewText: Really disappointed. Swimming pool is RARELY open to the public and paying members, especially after 5pm, so good luck if you have a job, I guess. Best time to go is mid-afternoon, but the chances are youâ€™ll show up to a sign on the door saying itâ€™s closed for another gala or swim club. Gym is always packed full after around 12pm, so again, good luck if you plan on going after work. If you like cycling, youâ€™ll be okay because they have a LOT of bikes which are always empty, but everything else, like treadmills and spaces to stretch, you will have to stand around waiting for. If you come to the gym with a workout plan, youâ€™ll probably leave without being able to do half of it because of how busy it always is. It really should be bigger for the amount of members there are. I had a nice time at the yoga class, so that is one plus to the membership. If there was another leisure centre with a pool in Durham city, I would move to it instantly. And on top of all that, the opening times are disappointing compared to other gyms, especially on the weekends. The prices are so high for the VERY small opportunity you get to use any of the facilities. For example, today the pool was open to the public for only 2.5 hours mid-afternoon; if you work a job, youâ€™ll probably rarely get a chance to use the pool.
showerReviews.author: Stella

locations.title: Chester-le-Street Leisure Centre
locations.address: îƒˆBurns Green, Chester-le-Street DH3 3QH, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Used the soft play with my toddler (2yrs) and baby (4 months) and will not be returning due to the lack of baby changing facilities on the same floor as the soft play. The only facilities for me (a woman) to take my children are up two flights of stairs. My baby was in the pushchair and when I asked the receptionist how I was supposed to get upstairs with the pushchair while carrying my toddler she asked why didnâ€™t the seat of my pushchair unclip. I even had offers from some lovely users of the pool to look after my toddler while I took the baby upstairs but I am not comfortable with leaving my child with a stranger. I was told I couldnâ€™t use the pool changing as I canâ€™t take the pushchair in there which makes it incredibly difficult to carry both toddler, baby and the nappy bag. I shouldnâ€™t be made to feel that I cannot take two small children in nappies out to places by myself that are made for children and I find it hard to believe this has never been raised as an issue before.
showerReviews.author: Gemma Hindmarch

locations.address: îƒˆHigh St, Spennymoor DL16 6DB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: We went as a family and enjoyed ourselves. There is a long water slide, some splash buckets and a wave machine. You get 50 minutes which starts as you enter the water and you get a coloured band. We did get the full 50 minutes. We could have had longer! The staff are lovely. The changing rooms were nice and clean. We parked on farmfoods which was very nearby as the car park was full. It does get busy inside but we only queued about 10 mins max for the slide. They rotate the slide and wave pool so you get to experience each about 3 times in the 50 minutes youâ€™re there. They are bringing in booking but not for summer so if you want guaranteed entry without having to come back at a later time get there early for the first session is my advice. Or if you have to return there is a nice cafe with seating anyway.
showerReviews.author: Elaine Wilkinson

showerReviews.reviewText:
Weâ€™ve hosted a couple of kidsâ€™ parties at Spennymoor Leisure Centre, and each one has been fantastic from start to finish. Itâ€™s a brilliant venue for energetic, fun-filled celebrations that the kids absolutely love â€” and itâ€™s really well organised, which makes things so much easier for parents too.

There are plenty of party options available depending on what your child is into â€” from soft play and sports to swimming parties and bouncy castle setups. The facilities are modern, clean, and spacious, and the staff are great at making everything run smoothly. They take the stress off your shoulders and keep the children entertained and safe throughout the session.

One of the best things is how much space there is for the kids to burn off energy â€” itâ€™s ideal for bigger groups and works really well no matter the weather. The birthday packages are also really good value, especially considering whatâ€™s included.

The team are friendly, helpful, and clearly experienced with running childrenâ€™s events â€” they were always on hand to help with setup and keep things moving.

If youâ€™re looking for a fun, active, and affordable party option in the Spennymoor area, weâ€™d definitely recommend Spennymoor Leisure Centre. The kids will love it â€” and so will you!
showerReviews.author: John Welch

locations.title: Pace Health Club
locations.address: îƒˆRadisson Blu Hotel, Frankland Ln, Durham DH1 5TA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: As usual, I swpied by membership card and asked for a towel where the immediate response was that I would have to pay the fee for the bigger towel. I kindly asked for the small towel that is provided free as part of my membership. There was no apology given, only response was that they were out and I would have to pay for the upgrade to get a towel. One of the biggest decisions for selecting this membership was that towels are provided and I do not carry any of my own. I responded that if the gym fails to stock the regular towels, that is the responsibility of the gym and not that of the customer and therefore would have to be made good by the gym. The manager argued that it wasn't his fault as he had ordered them and they didn't arrive. Some real professionalism at play here. Someone in a management position should know the difference between me addressing him as an individual vs the face of your gym. I tried explaining again that the failings are on the part of the gym and not that of the customer and you cannot be expected to pay for the gyms shortcomings. All reasoning fell on deaf ears and I had no choice but to purchase the towel.
showerReviews.author: chin hun chung

showerReviews.reviewText:
Overall this Pace health club is of a good standard.
They have a sauna, steam room, jacuzzi, gym and 15m swimming pool.
In general the place is clean, although the odd time you go there can be plastic cups everywhere due to people not using the bins.
You can have a relaxing time.
They often have spa packages available at affordable prices.
The staff are always friendly and happy to help.
I would say this place is worth a visit.

locations.title: Bannatyne Health Club And Spa
locations.address: îƒˆEden Terrace, Durham DH1 2HJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
*5/5 Stars - A Blissful Oasis of Relaxation!*

I recently had the pleasure of visiting Bannatyne Durham, and it was the perfect antidote to a busy week. From the moment I stepped through the doors, I felt enveloped in a sense of calm and tranquility.

The spa facilities were top-notch - the pool, sauna, and steam room were all immaculately clean and well-maintained. But what really stood out was the exceptional service from the friendly and attentive staff. They went above and beyond to ensure I had everything I needed, from fresh towels to refreshing drinks.

I treated myself to a massage, and it was absolute heaven. The therapist was skilled, knowledgeable, and tailored the treatment to my specific needs. I left feeling like a new person - relaxed, rejuvenated, and ready to take on the world!

The gym and fitness facilities were also impressive, with state-of-the-art equipment and a great selection of classes. But for me, the real highlight was the spa's serene atmosphere and stunning views of the surrounding countryside.

Whether you're looking to relax, unwind, or simply indulge in some me-time, Bannatyne Durham is the perfect destination. I'll definitely be back - and soon!

*Highly recommended for:* Spa days, massages, relaxation, fitness, and stunning views!
showerReviews.author: Hannah K

showerReviews.reviewText: Thereâ€™s nothing Spa Day or zen like about Bannatyneâ€™s and we will be looking elsewhere in future. We arrived to a long line at the reception desk, no excitement or warm welcome for a Spa Day. Â£10 charge for bag, flip flops, towel and robe which is nonrefundable and towel & robe to be given back before exiting - after paying for the Spa day I think Â£10 each is excessive for a flimsy bag and those cheap flip flops. Robes were well used, not soft and on the small side. We were given an explanation of where everything was which was helpful. We were told to wait on the sofas near our treatment time in the cafe area - they have tried to make this section designated for Spa Guests with signs specifically stating this but we had to sit with 2 women eating food and a lone man reading a newspaper (maybe just the entitled older generation who just do what they want regardless of what the area is designated for) a member of staff from the cafe served the 2 women food whilst we were sat there in robes and I honestly think they should have been asked to move. Itâ€™s not fair to Spa Guests. The treatments and the girls who completed them were great. The treatments were relaxing and we enjoyed them - would have liked the room warmer but that is my only grumble for that. We moved to the relaxation room (comical name) with hot stone beds (some working, some not) and mood lighting but you couldnâ€™t relax from all the external noise - doors banging, what sounded like a water/pump thing constantly going off, laughter and loud talking from reception area and others. Pool area was had what you would need, clean, able to use everything, apart from the 4 loungers as a group of four also having a spa day had placed their towels on them even though they werenâ€™t using them and didnâ€™t use them the full hour we were in using the facilities - this really should be monitored by staff to make it fair for all those having Spa Days - you arenâ€™t on the bed and the towel is, it gets removed. Cafe was ok, clinical and not very relaxing/comfortable for a spa day, some good options but expensive. We wouldnâ€™t return - I donâ€™t think you can be both youâ€™re either for fitness or for spa days - for the size of the area inside it doesnâ€™t work for both especially where the relaxation room is located.
showerReviews.author: N L

showerReviews.reviewText:
I visited Bannatyne Health Club and Spa after being gifted a red letters spa day. Booking the day was super easy, the pre communication was also great. On entering the club, the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. There is a Â£10 charge for a spa bag, which wasn't a problem but unsure why they don't just include this within the deal, it included a robe, towel and flip flops (robe and towel to be returned as expected). I opted for a back massage, I asked the therapist for this to be firm pressure and she got this spot on, I could hear the knots being removed from my shoulders !
The facilities were very clean, the only negative comment would be the swimming pool was quite cold, as an ex swimmer, this wouldn't normally bother me but my mother in law did find it too cold and didn't last very long ago at all in the pool.
There appeared to be a good range of food and drinks on offer in the lounge cafe bar, the food we had was nice and appeared reasonably priced for the quality and portion size.
I would recommend this for anyone looking for a spa day, although some facilities were not 'as fancy' in comparison to other spas on the area, I do feel this was reflected in the cost.

locations.title: Hetton Community Pool & Wellness Centre
locations.address: îƒˆBernard Park, Hetton-le-Hole, Houghton le Spring DH5 9LZ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I'd be happy to write a positive review about Hetton Community Pool and Wellness Center!

From the moment I walked into the center, I was struck by how clean and well-maintained the facilities were. The staff was friendly and welcoming, and they were happy to answer any questions I had about the center's amenities.

The pool itself is fantastic. It's a great size, and the water temperature is perfect for swimming. The pool area is also well-lit, which makes it easy to see where you're going and what you're doing. I especially appreciated the fact that there were plenty of lane markers, which made it easy to navigate around other swimmers.

In addition to the pool, the center offers a variety of other wellness amenities, such as a fully-equipped gym, a sauna, and a steam room. I really enjoyed the gym, which had a great selection of equipment and was kept very clean.

Overall, I would highly recommend Hetton Community Pool and Wellness Center to anyone looking for a great place to swim, work out, and relax. The facilities are top-notch, the staff is friendly and knowledgeable, and the sense of community is truly something special.
showerReviews.author: Christopher Kelly

showerReviews.reviewText:
Do not take your baby or young child here!!

After booking the only family swimming slot today we walked into ear deafening club music being blasted at 10.30am in the morning the entire time, my son clung to me covering his ears the entire time. There was no notice or way of knowing this when you booked the slot online.

When we tried to leave a group of school kids came in for the lesson, they pushed past us and took every baby changing room and even adults shut the baby change doors on my infant 1 year olds face, members of staff and the school staff watched and awkwardly and did nothing. It took 20 minutes and a nice random elder lady to hold open a baby change door and shout for us.

When we finally got inside the baby change room it was nothing lile the one we used on the way in, there was no water or handwash facility unlike the first and the room was also smaller. It was just a red plastic table with a small indent for a baby and a hole in the middle.

When my child had a accident I was left in a small room with urine puddling on the floor bellow us and nothing to help me wash my child. I managed to wrap up all my things and move the the ONLY baby changing stall with running water then quickly leave.

Having 1 decent baby change room and 6 other basic rooms is not okay.
Staff members and school staff watching as children and adults selfishly take baby change rooms because of the bigger size and push and shut doors in our face is not okay.

Never bring your infant here.
showerReviews.author: Carl Hobbs

showerReviews.reviewText:
The gym is OK when it's quiet, but as it's quite a small gum, when it's busy, you find yourself waiting around for equipment to become available.

As for swimming, it's rather pointless due to public swimming times being very limited.

The biggest benefit to this gym is the friendly staff and how close the gym is to my home.

But sadly, you'll pay over the top for what you actually get, a small gym area, and little to no swimming time.

If you are employed, you'd be better off going to a different gym.

showerReviews.reviewText:
The complex has decent facilities, but the fitness suite can get busy. It's not full of meat heads like some gyms but it certainly doesn't have a sociable atmosphere. It's cheap and cheerful, but the facilities are due an upgrade.

I've never seen the staff cleaning the equipment and few people wipe down after use. The induction was very brief and cleanliness should be emphasised more.

The showers are great, hot, clean, and have a decentâ€‹ flow! But the changing rooms can get dirty especially when there are sport events. The venue would benefit from having a couple of full time cleaners, or by asking fitness suite staff to clean equipment regularly.

So... Cheap (for Durham) decent gym, but no classes and sometimes slightly unclean!

showerReviews.reviewText:
After joining the gym in October 2022 its now a place I look forward to going to 6 days a week, the place is clean, has modern equipment and a positive social atmosphere.

The staff all have knowledge in different areas of fitness and are always happy to give advice or just have a chat.

The gym does have very busy periods but it's manageable and most people are happy to work in.

The staff run a variation of classes from boxersize to pilates which are fun and are as challenging as you make them.

Cafe is fairly priced with a great range of hot and cold food and drinks including protien shakes, protien bars and cafe nero coffee.

Showers are always clean, have consistent hot water and have good water pressure.

Often when I've been there the staff have been lacking in motivation when interacting with members of the public. And I often hear them complaining to each other how much they hate working there.
The track is great and well looked after though. Just first impressions go along way. But the staff attitude has put me off wanting to try other area's of the site.
showerReviews.author: Tom Clay

showerReviews.reviewText:
Unprofessional and disorganised with poor communication and a fight to get a refund for lessons cancelled by the provider.

After five weeks of lessons cancelled (due to pool refurb), we arrived to be informed the pH level in the pool was incorrect, and the lesson was cancelled. The children in the pool were told to get out immediately, and take a long shower.

We decided to cancel our son's lessons after this most recent incident, so emailed Swim to inform them. We were advised we had cancelled the Direct Debit, so we'd broken the terms of conditions of the contract, so weren't eligible for a refund of payment taken May 1st. However, we had not cancelled the Direct Debit, and it is still active.

I would not recommend this shambles of an organisation to anyone. Lessons often start late, cancelled when you arrive, constant re branding mean children don't know where they are with assessment and instructors change frequently. Avoid!
showerReviews.author: Heather Redhead

showerReviews.reviewText:
Having returned to the UK after living in South Africa for nearly 30 years we were eager to come and swim in the Lido as we are not keen on indoor pools. We had the most amazing morning-the pool was not busy but it was a cooler day than some. We arrived about 10am on a Sat morning. Plenty of space to swim-lovely and warm once we got in but could have been a little warmer for us.. Great to have the showers on site and change facilities if required too. We had a lovely coffee from the on site catering van -highly recommend..
We returned today to try the restaurant and were not disappointed. We had really lovely meals. I can recommend the house salad ,it was not just a pile of lettuce leaves with the usual chunks of tomato and cucumber but a delectable plate of finely mixed ingredients and gorgeous dressing -well worth the price and even  though the restaurant was busy over the lunch time and had a 'kitchen crisis' it still felt very relaxing. The staff are amazing and seemed to be really enjoying their job... There is lots more to try and we have already made a booking for a family birthday celebration.
We will be back very soon Saltdean Lido as there is more to explore...
showerReviews.author: Landi Lady

showerReviews.reviewText:
A great pool to swim in - what a fantastic setting and brilliant to see the pool and buildings being fully restored.
Pool is around 40m length and gently heated during winter to 19Â° which is quite chilly in just a swimsuit. Booked tickets in advance and the price is reasonable (especially compared to Sea Lanes). Free parking on site.
Not sure if the current changing area is temporary? These seemed fairly rudimentary and relatively few changing cubicles. Lockers available, although you'll need somewhere to store the locker key! Showers lovely and warm.
Deco cafe looked lovely, but was already full when we visited - obviously a popular spot!
Would return again when restoration fully completed. Definitely one not to miss!
showerReviews.author: Anya Chapman

showerReviews.reviewText: Highlighting the reception desk staff today. I haven't been swimming for several months. Despite this, as I fumbled with my app, the receptionist offered "I will buzz you through Rose". Such a small interaction, yet such an amazing piece of customer service. I am lucky that on a daily basis, I am warmly welcomed by my family at home. I am also a therapist. For some of my most isolated clients, those little day to day interactions can be literally life saving. As well as thanking the receptionist for their care, I hope Better management sees this review too. At time when so much is being automated to save on costs (understandable), I hope Better recognises how much value that one staff member, is adding to the community of Lido users (and therefore to Better as an organisation).
showerReviews.author: Rose C Jiggens

locations.title: Letchworth Lido
locations.address: îƒˆIcknield Way, Letchworth Garden City SG6 4UF, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Lovely, 50m, heated pool which is open during the summer season. The pool itself is clean, minimal debris, and was heated to around 25Â° when we visited during a rainy 8am lane swim. Booked in advance via the everyone active app. Plenty of parking at the pool, which is free for up to 2 hours. Communal male (turn right from entrance) and female (turn left) changing rooms, which were clean but basic. Hot showers and clean toilets alongside lockers (50p refundable) available. The walk from the female changing rooms to the shallow end is a bit of a trek, so recommend taking sliders. The lane swim was a popular session, but the pool is so big that the lanes were generous (double width slow lane) so it didn't feel too crowded. Attentive life guards. Tank is very shallow at the shallow end, so watch your knees if doing breaststroke!
showerReviews.author: Anya Chapman

locations.address: îƒˆWaterside Ct, Stanhope, Bishop Auckland DL13 2LU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Visited with my 2 children, 2-4pm.

The day was sunny, the pool was a lovely welcome!

Parking could be limited outside the pool as it is used for people to access the nearby park and the ford. Arrive in good time if you want to park outside the pool!!

The pool itself, for its age, was nice. The reports of â€˜green waterâ€™ are probably because the pool doesnâ€™t have blue tiles at the bottom, instead, it looked like painted concrete which was showing itâ€™s age. The water itself looked clean though. Lifeguards on-site at all times. A little shop serving crisps, sweets, tea/coffee. It was just like being on holiday with chairs and sun loungers around the pool.

Changing facilities are as expected for the age - but well maintained and quite clean.
Cubicles/baby change room and a shower with toilet facilities. Lockers on-site for 20p, which I didnâ€™t use as I had my bag near the pool.

Kids loved it.
Unfortunately for me, a family of rude â€˜knackersâ€™ spoilt part of my enjoyment this time, but thatâ€™s no fault of the poolâ€™s.

I would return :)

showerReviews.reviewText:
My partner and I only joined this gym on Tuesday, and so far, we absolutely love it. It's the best Gym Group gym that we've ever been to, and we've been to 3 different ones.

The atmosphere is so good at this gym, I love the location of the machines too. I like that the cardio machines are all in the same area.

The changing rooms are very spacious, and are very clean.

Craig is the only staff member who I have spoken to, and you can tell that he is clearly a manager who cares about the gym, and the experiences of the gym users.

I highly recommend this gym. It's much better than Gym Group Middlesbrough.
showerReviews.author: Paige Lipscomb

showerReviews.reviewText:
Lots of equipment to use and it's mostly in good condition, though some of the pads could do with being swapped out more often. There's plenty of parking and the place is generally clean. It's well priced and the app is useful for seeing how busy the gym is.

Don't expect to be able to use the male showers though. The shower heads and doors have all been broken for at least the last 5 months despite management apparently being aware of it.
showerReviews.author: Christopher Scarre

showerReviews.reviewText:
Tried most of the gyms in town and despite being a chain TGG Darlington ticks all the boxes of:
Well maintained and available Equipment - even in peak times!
Not overly crowded.
Kind staff - always available if you need a spot or assistance... Or just a natter!
Clean changing facilities.

Definitely get a bang for your buck, highly recommend it!

Really great gym. Large, 24hrs and has a large range of equipment.

They have recently installed a fourth squat rack and now have two really good ones. There are two proper benches and loads of free benches.

It doesn't get that busy especially if you don't go at peak times and the price is very decent. Staff are always friendly and helpful.

There's also a locker room with showers which is nice.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Really disappointed!!! You closed the gym on the 22/05/2025 to carry out maintenance and freshen the place up. I assume you would have used the day to really clean every equipment. The cleanliness of the gym is unsatisfactory. The leg press machine, in particular, appears dirty and covered in dust and hairs. The floors are not clean. Additionally, it seems that all the equipment are not being wiped down or disinfected regularly. There are no paper towels or disinfectant spray available for members to wipe off their sweat. I understand that youâ€™re trying to save costs and help the environment but maybe you can provide disposable wipes. Iâ€™ve noticed that while this is a low-cost gym, my previous gym group had a cleaner who was consistently visible after peak hours for just 30 minutes. This cleaner not only cleared up any rubbish but also cleaned the floors and equipment.

Please note that my review is not intended to create a negative image of this gym. Iâ€™m simply suggesting that you could consider implementing a similar cleaning schedule to ensure that your customers have a clean and hygienic environment.
showerReviews.author: Unending Praise 04

showerReviews.reviewText: Recently joined this gym as it's easier for me to access and has better equipment for everyone to use unlike the Neptune near Morrisons. Anyways I went for my induction this morning and got shown how to use the machines safely and correctly by a member of the gym group team, the person was encouraging and friendly towards me during it. The only downside for me is the mens changing room as it is way too small and compact because while I was in there getting changed after my workout. it became full quite quickly, Perhaps needs a rethink and improvement in that area but everything of this gym is fantastic and looking forward to coming back regularly.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great location, parking and the Gym itself is great with it's layout and the facilities regarding free weights and machines.
Staff are happy and friendly and always willing to help. Changing rooms big enough and cleaned regularly.
Changing rooms/showers close at certain times (nights) but understandable due to health and safety, but the Gym itself is 24/7.
Enjoying my use....... A++

showerReviews.reviewText:
A honest review of JD Gyms washington
As a member for 5+ years

In the past 5 years this place has gone drastically down hill. Huge turn over of staff! They used to be professional clean and hard working. However times have changed and not for the better..

Firstly a thank you to JOEY always kind,helping, friendly and happy to see the patrons of the gym.

However for the rest of them. The new cleaners moan on constantly about doing their job. Cleaning it's your job, don't like it get a different one, constantly in the mens locker room so you feel uncomfortable getting changed due to female presence in there. They have a bad attitude to the male members regarding a service they provide in the locker rooms.(the sauna) shutting down the shower facilities from 6 down to just 2 before 9pm. You have to wait for a hot shower if you dont time it right. Furthermore they remove the drain covers so you have to watch your step constantly so you dont fall in and do damage to your foot or ankle. Surely this is a health and saftey failure. Not to mention they stink of sewage when the covers are removed. The showers are not heat adjustable so always hot. Every patron i speak to when mentioned in conversation will mention the lack of a cold shower yet the managemt refuse to spend a little bit of money changing just one of the showers into a cold shower.(sunderland have this so why not washington) None of the floor staff do any 5S and the place is a free for all with weights and equipment just abandoned all over the gym. Its always messy and unhygienic due to the lack of cleaning equipment.(covid days where wipes and sanitiser was provided) like it used to be before going 24 hours.

Classes have also became very limited in what they offer its a real shame for those who joined the gym for the classes once provided

The place is Full of steroids, women recording workouts and men who perve on every woman who enters the gym. Yes ladies everything you do the men are watching your arse or your chest! They are vile pervs,Old and young.

The place is full of squads of school kids

Stinks of weed coming from lockers in the locker room yet the staff do nothing about it.

The boxing area is atrocious. Soaking wet floor all of the time but hey ho a wet floor sign is good enough to cover the gyms insurance if anyone slips on it and breaks their neck. The staff sign off the hourly check sheet without batting an eye lid at the place. They allow members to kick the punching bags although it's against the boxing rules signage. This has lead to many hand injuries over the years from damaged bags. Since going 24/7 they have enclosed the boxing area so it no longer feels like part of the gym which causes the feeling of isolation and a prison like experience.

If you are working out during the night there is no locker rooms available and only a disgusting disabled toilet for all to use.

The drains stink
The staff are arrogant
And I certainly won't be using JD gyms again ðŸ‘‹ no need for a reply from JD GYMS WASHINGTON im not interested in your response
showerReviews.author: Matty Burkett

REFURBED SUPER GYM!
The gym was nice before it had a facelift - now it's even better!
Updated Free Weights Area, Eleiko Functional Training Rig, Glute Training Zone and many new machines.
Studios, changing rooms and saunas are the same, but classes are still included in the price.
Oh, and it's now 24 hour opening, so it's even better value for money.
Be sure to check it out!

The toilets/ changing rooms are very tidy and clean and my partner says the same about the male ones.
The music is awful that is a thing that let's it down. During the day it's very busy and the music is less noticeable. I take headphones anyway but if you go on a night time the music is far too loud for me and it would be better in my opinion if it could be a little quieter.
Overall its a nice gym and I enjoy going.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Disappointing Experience â€“ Safety, Accountability and Respect Ignored.

Iâ€™m writing this review to share my deeply disappointing experience with JD Gyms and to warn other members â€” particularly women â€” about the way concerns are handled by management.

During a recent visit, my phone was greatly damaged as a result of reckless behaviour by a group of young males in the gym. Despite having clearly set up equipment for myself, one individual jumped onto it, dislodging a weight which landed on my phone, leaving me feeling intimidated,  upset and frustrated. Staff later confirmed the incident via CCTV, acknowledged the behaviour, and even banned the individuals involved â€” implicitly accepting the behaviour and actions were unacceptable.

Despite this, JD Gyms has completely refused to accept any responsibility. Their management has shown little interest in resolving the matter or even offering support. I was told to take it up with the individuals involved â€” rather than the gym recognising that they failed to enforce their own rules or provide a safe environment. Their attitude has been dismissive, evasive, and frankly disrespectful.

This isnâ€™t just about a phone. Itâ€™s about how a business responds when a female member is made to feel unsafe, ignored, and passed around between managers who want to wash their hands of the issue. There was no apology, no accountability, and no effort to make things right â€” just an attempt to pass the blame.

JD Gyms may have impressive equipment, but their attitude toward member safety and responsibility is seriously lacking. I wouldnâ€™t feel comfortable recommending them to anyone who expects even basic standards of care, support, or professionalism when something goes awry.
showerReviews.author: Karimah Miah

showerReviews.reviewText: As a 1st gym goer at 46 , I have nought to compare it too. It was clean .. friendly , I did want to use the treadmills , I got showed earlier in the day how to use them by my request.. but couldn't get any of them to work . So used other exercise pods spent about 2 hours there .. and rather liked it got a good sweat on , I  thought the other buff folk would be intimidating.. but they weren't .. they just doing there own thing . Music was good . Water refill fountains , after 22:00 there's a private shower cubicle,  it did take a couple minutes for warm water to come through this in turn led to a bit of a puddle .. there's drinks available in the machine . Provided I don't ache too much tomorrow I suspect I will frequent often. They have little diagrams on the machine s telling you what do and which muscles it exercises , I'm quite tall 6"7 ISH , some of the machines clearly don't have super tall folk in mind .. most that I tried were fine.
showerReviews.author: AH POZZA

showerReviews.reviewText:
Price is creeping up, but still good value for the equipment and soon to come 24/7 opening.

With that said, someone needs to reassess how they run classes. The gym isn't set up to be hosting Hyrox style classes where people are stumbling around the locker and changing room entrances doing sandbag lunges and kettlebells farmers walks. It's an accident waiting to happen.

Wouldn't be so bad if the class timetable was kept up to date so people could avoid it, but that doesn't seem to be the case, so you're left having to deal with the disruption as well as the super loud music they play over the standard gym speakers.
showerReviews.author: Rob McKenzie

locations.title: JD Gyms Stockton South
locations.address: îƒˆYarm Rd, Stockton-on-Tees TS18 3SF, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
In recent months, what was once an excellent gym has deteriorated into nothing more than a playground for unsupervised children. The facility is now overrun by groups of school-age individuals who appear to attend solely to socialise, run around, and film each other rather than train. They congregate around machines in groups of six or more, occupying equipment for excessive periods while contributing nothing to the gym environment.

Their behaviour is consistently disruptive and wholly unacceptable. They play games on the gym floor, set up tripods throughout the facilityâ€”including the changing roomsâ€”and even express irritation when members accidentally walk into their recordings. They vape openly, bring phones into the sauna to play music and watch TikTok, and leave rubbish scattered around without any consideration for others. Many of them clearly have no understanding of how to use the equipment safely, placing themselves at significant risk of injury.

This conduct has driven numerous long-standing members to leave, and it is deeply concerning that such issues have been allowed to escalate to this level. JD Gym: this must be addressed immediately. Are you content with the increasingly appalling reputation your establishment is developing, or are you simply willing to accept payment while the facility devolves into a childrenâ€™s playground?
showerReviews.author: Michael Collins

showerReviews.reviewText: Decent size gym two floors, first floor is cable machines and cardio equipment and spin class and studio there is a disability access elevator, nice lighting can be cold though exposed concrete roof. Upstairs freeweights and deadlift platforms and changing rooms and toilets, the gym is 24hours, decent variety off machines and weights ideally could do with more weights on deadlift platforms as it lacks, overall decent size gym and equipment, situated right next to shopping mall be careful carpark is not free till after 3pm so you will need to pay, this would be the first jd ive come across what dosnt offer free parking for members where you type in your reg. Hopefully can be somthing they can sort out in future.

I complained more than once to no avail

I gave a months notice to cancel my membership and they still took another months payment by a very clever process.
The delay in getting in touch with you to answer mails is a lie in the hope you give up
I advise anyone to cancel membership AND direct debit at the bank because they WILL ROB YOU .

I've only had the breakfast so can only comment on that, but what a load of overpriced slop, belt buster; 8.50, 2 cheap sausages, anemic fried potatoes, eggs with jelly inðŸ¤¢(undercooked) and really salty bacon, no toast or bread, plus 2 pound for a instant coffee, yes I had instant decaf coffee. I don't mind paying for a quality breakfast, what I do mind is paying quality prices for sub par food

locations.address: îƒˆ20 Claypath, Durham DH1 1RH, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I really enjoyed my year at Student Castle; I wish I wasn't a finalist, or that something similar existed for graduates!

The reception, security and cleaning staff are all very friendly and attentive. There is round the clock help if you need to collect parcels or use the facilities.

The rooms are light and modern with good amenities and good water pressure (including a rain shower). Heating works well, so rooms are very warm in the cold Durham winters. Beware they can be a bit stuffy in the summer months, I'd advise buying a fan if you've got hayfever and can't have the windows open.

Studios do not come with a kettle or toaster.
showerReviews.author: Philip Romeril

locations.title: Travelodge Durham
locations.address: îƒˆ9 Station Ln, Durham DH1 1LJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Building, sleeping within the walls where hundreds made their daily commute to work and back, survived decades of events and the gorgeous grade 2 listed building still stands.
Rooms, they were immaculate, clean and well kept.
Staff, friendly, helpful and gave a super warm welcome to some very tired folks at the end of their day exploring Durhams heritage.

We were given a room in the main building, which by the looks of it was where families are put to stay, we had our little dog who made himself very comfy for the night and we had a great night's sleep. The showers were hot, the service was great and our overall stay was perfect from start to end.
showerReviews.author: Caitin Western

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've stayed in a lot of Travelodge budget hotels. I don't expect a lot but in the case of Travelodge Durham I got much less than usual. First, the welcome. There wasn't one, just two grumpy receptionists for whom I was an inconvenience.

My room (106) was huge and the back third was totally empty. Nowhere, absolutely nowhere, to put my suitcase other than open it on the floor. Luckily I was able to find a small table elsewhere in the building which I "borrowed ".

The map I found at reception has the town at the very bottom and the hotel itself unmarked and off the edge. Useless and very unhelpful.

The hotel should also provide a map of the grounds. My room was hidden away in the rambling hotel grounds and badly signposted.

This Travelodge doesn't provide a hot breakfast. It's the only one I've been to like this. Perhaps there is low demand, but providing a decent breakfast should not be a matter of cost-benefit, but of providing a service to guests.

The bath needs a non-slip mat. Urgently. Especially as there is a high step up into the bath/shower. A warning sign isn't enough.

This Travelodge is designed for car travellers. I walked 1.5km up steep hills to get here from the railway station. It's also a long, steep walk to the nearest shop, a pub or a cafe/restaurant. There is an Italian restaurant on site, but it appears to be permanently shut.

Good points: double glazing keeps the heavy traffic noise out.
showerReviews.author: Arthur Hanlon

showerReviews.reviewText:
We have just spent the most peaceful night at Grove Farm, itâ€™s off the main road along a country lane and situated in the delightful village of Hett. The owners Tom and Mark could not be more welcoming to their lovely site which they clearly pride themselves on. The facilities are pristine with a lovely warm and spacious shower and some very nice hand wash in the toilet!
There are some some lovely walks nearby and the view from the site is rolling fields and countryside. If you want a site that gets you back to nature this is the one. The added bonus of the two adorable donkeys (Petunia and Marigold) in the paddock makes for a truly magnificent stay. We will definitely be back!
Please note there is no electric and this is clearly stated on the website and the owners always advise this on booking, I noted someone gave one star less for this which I canâ€™t understand as it is very clear they are a site that does not provide electric!
showerReviews.author: Tracy Shaw

showerReviews.reviewText:
We have just arrived home from a wknd at this site, we had seen the slight negative issues about facilities, but as they are only 2 of us in a caravan with our own, we decided to give it a go, as otherwise it sounded lovely.
We were met by a very friendly owner, she spoke to us on numerous occasions whilst we were there, very helpful. The pitches are a good size and the site is extremely clean.
As we had seen on previous reviews, the 2 porta loos and portable shower unit with 2 showers in, even though clean, let the site down. I'm glad our children are grown up, as I wouldn't have wanted to be 1 of the families in tents.
My other slight negative comment, is that we paid for a fully serviced pitch at Â£72 for 2 nights in total, but on arrival were told we had to turn the water off when not in use, it rained late on the first night, we really wouldn't have wanted to be going out to turn it on, to get a wash before bed, so we filled our water butt, not the best after what we paid.
Having spoke to the owner, we know they are in battles with their local council to get better facilities, so fingers crossed, as it does have the making of a higher star rating, sadly not just yet ðŸ¤ž
showerReviews.author: lesa blackburn

We have just arrived home from a wknd at this site, we had seen the slight negative issues about facilities, but as they are only 2 of us in a caravan with our own, we decided to give it a go, as otherwise it sounded lovely.
We were met by a very friendly owner, she spoke to us on numerous occasions whilst we were there, very helpful. The pitches are a good size and the site is extremely clean.
As we had seen on previous reviews, the 2 porta loos and portable shower unit with 2 showers in, even though clean, let the site down. I'm glad our children are grown up, as I wouldn't have wanted to be 1 of the families in tents.
My other slight negative comment, is that we paid for a fully serviced pitch at Â£72 for 2 nights in total, but on arrival were told we had to turn the water off when not in use, it rained late on the first night, we really wouldn't have wanted to be going out to turn it on, to get a wash before bed, so we filled our water butt, not the best after what we paid.
Having spoke to the owner, we know they are in battles with their local council to get better facilities, so fingers crossed, as it does have the making of a higher star rating, sadly not just yet ðŸ¤ž
showerReviews.author: lesa blackburn

showerReviews.reviewText:
Lovely small caravan park. Very quiet with amazing views. Spotlessly clean and tidy.  In a perfect location for weardale, teesdale, Barnard castle  and Durham city. Well kept family site with  Spotlessly clean toilets and showers, grey waste and chemical toilet disposal  and undercover washing up area.
Well worth a visit, we love this site! The owners are very friendly and helpful and can't do enough for you. Great children's play area too!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Just home after a fabulous four night stay (despite the high winds) at Stag Park, Hamsterley.
On arrival we were greeted by the lovely Beth who showed us to our pitch and pointed out showers, toilets, wash up area, fire extinguishers etc, advised us of free wi-fi access and emergency telephone number.
The facilities are spotless as is the park, well kept huge hardstanding and grass pitches with picnic benches to use if needed- shout out to Justin and family members for all pulling together, such a lovely friendly family. Letâ€™s not forget Keith the donkey and co who are just amazing to watch in the field. Didnâ€™t really need the kids play area ðŸ˜‰ but it is fab and safe.
Many thanks for letting us stay, Anne John Craig and Nancy the dog.

showerReviews.reviewText: Just came back from the site today...what a hidden gem. ...very secure with large gates that are closed every night.....owners live on site and they are lovely.... beautiful surroundings. ..great pitches with electric and Water....toilets spotless...washing area...showers lovely.... if you are looking for  a seasonal pitch in peace and quiet where you would feel very safe I would recommend 100%.... but be quick as I think when more people find this site it won't stay empty for long  .. thank you for our lovely weekend and giving us caravaners a lovely safe friendly place to stay....
showerReviews.author: Carole Mason

showerReviews.reviewText:
We had a fantastic stay at Stag Park Caravan Site and would highly recommend it to anyone! The facilities (including the toilets, showers, and washing area) were spotlessly clean, and the camping grounds were beautifully maintained. The staff were incredibly friendly and went above and beyond to help us when our car broke down. Their kindness made a stressful situation so much easier. We truly appreciated everything and would absolutely come back again, highly recommended!

showerReviews.reviewText: Disappointing given the reviews from last year. Site manager not on site. Turns up once or twice a day to turn on generator for hot water and lights in toilets. Toilets not clean. One communal shower only in gents toilet block. Civil engineering working all hours days and night with large excavation machines in field behind the site. Shame as site is good hard standing and ideal for visiting the area which is lovely.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed here in a tent for a few nights during the school holidays. Lovely little site, the kids enjoyed it and the owner was very helpful and friendly making sure everything was ok.

Good location with a few good places close by to occupy the kids.

Toilet block and the shower was very clean and well looked after.

Would highly recommend.
